original: @260b / /rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @260b / /rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya ratna r'a shi n'a ma mah'a y'a na s'u tra /
analyzed: a'arya ratna r'a shi n'a ma mah'a y'a na s'u tra /
translated: Ārya-ratna-rāśi-nāma-mahāyāna-sūtra

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa rin po che'i phung po zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo //
analyzed: 'phags pa rin po che'i phung po zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo //
translated: The Noble Great Vehicle Sūtra called The Jewel Heap

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Part One

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas!

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time:

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri la dge slong brgyad stong tsam gyi dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' khri drug stong @261a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri la dge slong brgyad stong tsam gyi dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' khri drug stong @261a *//
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling on Vulture Peak Mountain in Rājagṛha with a great saṅgha of about eight thousand monks and sixteen thousand bodhisattvas gathered from various buddha-fields.

original: dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs te /
analyzed: dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs te /
translated: He was dwelling together with them.

original: thams cad kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: All of them were thus:

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu skye ba gcig gis thogs pa phyir mi ldog pa'i bzod pa thob pa sha stag go //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu skye ba gcig gis thogs pa phyir mi ldog pa'i bzod pa thob pa sha stag go //
translated: They were irreversible, having attained the acceptance of birth in only one life remaining to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Mahā­kāśyapa asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bgyi ba ji tsam gyis na dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bgyi ba lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bgyi ba ji tsam gyis na dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bgyi ba lags /
translated: “Blessed One, what is it that makes a monk a monk?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'ong srung chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'ong srung chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Mahā­kāśyapa,

original: 'od srung / dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni zhi ba dang / dul ba dang / cang shes pa dang / tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa shes pas dge sbyong zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni zhi ba dang / dul ba dang / cang shes pa dang / tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa shes pas dge sbyong zhes bya ste /
translated: “Kāśyapa, a monk is called a monk because he is peaceful, disciplined, obedient, has a pure aggregate of discipline, and knows how to enter into meditative absorption.

original: shes rab dang ldan pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i snying po lhur len pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la som nyi med cing the tshom mi za ba dang / 'phags pa'i spyod yul la gnas pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i snying po lhur len pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la som nyi med cing the tshom mi za ba dang / 'phags pa'i spyod yul la gnas pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la gnas pa dang /
translated: They are endowed with wisdom, they are intent on the essence of liberation, they are free of doubt and hesitation regarding the three gates of liberation, they abide in the domain of the noble ones, they abide in the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi la gnas pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom pa bsgoms pa dang / dad pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas la dad pa mi phyed pa dang / chos la dad pa mi phyed pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi la gnas pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom pa bsgoms pa dang / dad pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas la dad pa mi phyed pa dang / chos la dad pa mi phyed pa dang /
translated: they abide in the four right efforts, they cultivate the four bases of supernatural power, they possess the faculty of faith, they have unwavering faith in the Buddha, they have unwavering faith in the Dharma,

original: dge 'dun la dad pa mi phyed pa dang / sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la shes nas dad pa dang @261b ldan pa dang / gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa dang / dge ba'i chos rnams la brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang /
analyzed: dge 'dun la dad pa mi phyed pa dang / sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la shes nas dad pa dang @261b ldan pa dang / gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa dang / dge ba'i chos rnams la brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang /
translated: they have unwavering faith in the Saṅgha, they possess the knowledge and faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha, they possess the wisdom that does not depend on others, they are diligent in virtuous qualities,

original: srid pa bcom pa dang / yang dag par zhugs pa dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin la mkhas pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa dang / shes rab kyis lhag mthong la mkhas pa dang / stobs lnga dang ldan pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi brdzi ba dang /
analyzed: srid pa bcom pa dang / yang dag par zhugs pa dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin la mkhas pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa dang / shes rab kyis lhag mthong la mkhas pa dang / stobs lnga dang ldan pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi brdzi ba dang /
translated: It is to destroy existence, to be correctly engaged, to be skilled in mindfulness and vigilance, to have a one-pointed mind, to be skilled in the insight of wisdom, to possess the five powers, to be unassailable by any affliction,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la bsam gtan pa dang / chos rnams kyi brten pa shes pa la mkhas pa dang / lam shes pa dang / lam la mkhas pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la bsam gtan pa dang / chos rnams kyi brten pa shes pa la mkhas pa dang / lam shes pa dang / lam la mkhas pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: to be absorbed in the seven factors of awakening, to be skilled in knowing the basis of phenomena, to know the path, to be skilled in the path, to have right view, and to have right absorption.

original: zhi gnas lhag mthong bsgom pa la mkhas pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa dang / don la rton gyi tshig 'bru la mi rton pa dang / ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la mi rton pa dang /
analyzed: zhi gnas lhag mthong bsgom pa la mkhas pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa dang / don la rton gyi tshig 'bru la mi rton pa dang / ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la mi rton pa dang /
translated: It is to be skilled in cultivating tranquility and insight, to possess the wisdom that is not dependent on others with regard to the four discernments, to rely on the meaning and not on the letter, to rely on wisdom and not on consciousness,

original: nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton gyi drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la mi rton pa dang / chos nyid la rton gyi gang zag la mi rton pa dang / bdud bzhi'i lam las shin tu 'das pa dang / phung po yongs su shes pa bsrung ba dang /
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton gyi drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la mi rton pa dang / chos nyid la rton gyi gang zag la mi rton pa dang / bdud bzhi'i lam las shin tu 'das pa dang / phung po yongs su shes pa bsrung ba dang /
translated: Protecting the thorough knowledge of the aggregates,🔽Eliminating afflictions,🔽Embodying the final body,🔽Correctly transcending the path of the Lord of Death,🔽Correctly knowing suffering,

original: nyon mongs pa bsal ba dang / tha ma'i lus 'dzin pa dang / 'chi bdag gi lam las yang dag par 'das pa dang / sdug bsngal ba yang dag par yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba thams cad spangs pa dang / @262a *//
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bsal ba dang / tha ma'i lus 'dzin pa dang / 'chi bdag gi lam las yang dag par 'das pa dang / sdug bsngal ba yang dag par yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba thams cad spangs pa dang / @262a *//
translated: Abandoning all origins,🔽Engaging in the realization of cessation,🔽Engaging in the yoga of cultivating the path,🔽Seeing the four noble truths,🔽Not relying on others,

original: 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba la zhugs pa dang / lam bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rjes su zhugs pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mthong ba dang / gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa dang / ston pa'i bstan pa la bya ba byas pa dang /
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba la zhugs pa dang / lam bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rjes su zhugs pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mthong ba dang / gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa dang / ston pa'i bstan pa la bya ba byas pa dang /
translated: Performing the teachings of the Teacher,

original: byed pa byas pa dang / zag pa zad pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan pa dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong bas bsu ba dang / sngon gyi spyod pa dang bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: byed pa byas pa dang / zag pa zad pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan pa dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong bas bsu ba dang / sngon gyi spyod pa dang bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: It is to have completed one’s actions, to have exhausted defilements, to be absorbed in the eight liberations, to be welcomed by Śakra, Brahmā, and the world guardians, and to have perfected one’s previous conduct and intentions.

original: dgon pa la gnas par mngon par dga' ba dang / 'phags pa'i rigs la gnas pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan la gnas pa dang / blo gya gyu med pa dang / rab tu byung nas khyim gyi gnas dang mi 'dre ba dang / bse ru ltar gcig pur rgyu ba dang /
analyzed: dgon pa la gnas par mngon par dga' ba dang / 'phags pa'i rigs la gnas pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan la gnas pa dang / blo gya gyu med pa dang / rab tu byung nas khyim gyi gnas dang mi 'dre ba dang / bse ru ltar gcig pur rgyu ba dang /
translated: It is to delight in dwelling in the wilderness, to abide in the family of the noble ones, to abide in the qualities of training, to be without crookedness of mind, to not mix with householders after going forth, to move about alone like a rhinoceros,

original: 'du 'dzis 'jigs skrag pa dang / khams gsum las rnam par grol ba dang / rtag tu 'jigs pa'i yid dang ldan pa dang / yang dag pa'i dge sbyong gi tshul la gnas pa dang / thams cad la 'dod pa med pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad po rnyed pa dang /
analyzed: 'du 'dzis 'jigs skrag pa dang / khams gsum las rnam par grol ba dang / rtag tu 'jigs pa'i yid dang ldan pa dang / yang dag pa'i dge sbyong gi tshul la gnas pa dang / thams cad la 'dod pa med pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad po rnyed pa dang /
translated: to be terrified of crowds, to be liberated from the three realms, to always have a fearful mind, to abide in the way of true spiritual practice, to have no desires for anything, to be free from the eight worldly concerns, and to be free from the five obscurations.

original: ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa rnams las yang dag par 'das pa dang / sa dang mtshungs pa'i sems kyis nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang /🔽bdag dang gzhan rjes su bsrung ba dang / @262b 'khrul pa med pa dang / 'khrug pa med pa dang / yang dag par zhugs pa dang / nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i sems kyis nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad la de'i sems mi chags /
analyzed: ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa rnams las yang dag par 'das pa dang / sa dang mtshungs pa'i sems kyis nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / bdag dang gzhan rjes su bsrung ba dang / @262b 'khrul pa med pa dang / 'khrug pa med pa dang / yang dag par zhugs pa dang / nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i sems kyis nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad la de'i sems mi chags /
translated: He is beyond gain and loss, fame and obscurity, pleasure and pain, praise and blame. He is like the earth, for his mind is even.🔽He is beyond self and other, without error, without disturbance, and he is correctly engaged. He is like space, for his mind is even.

original: mi 'ching ste /🔽dper na / nam mkha' la lag mthil bzhin du mi chags /
analyzed: mi 'ching ste / dper na / nam mkha' la lag mthil bzhin du mi chags /
translated: His mind is not attached to or bound by any sign.

original: mi 'ching ba yin te /
analyzed: mi 'ching ba yin te /
translated: For example, it is not attached to or bound by the palm of the hand, like space.

original: 'od srung / dge sbyong gi chos rnam pa de lta bu de dag dang ldan na dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / dge sbyong gi chos rnam pa de lta bu de dag dang ldan na dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, if a monk has these qualities, he is a true monk.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Mahā­kāśyapa said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis yang dag pa'i dge sbyong gi yon tan 'di dag yang dag par rab tu bstan pa ni ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis yang dag pa'i dge sbyong gi yon tan 'di dag yang dag par rab tu bstan pa ni ngo mtshar to //
translated: it is truly amazing that the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One has thus revealed the qualities of a true spiritual practitioner.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ma mchis pa'i dus na gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub bskal pa grangs ma mchis par yang dag par bsgrubs pa nub par bgyid pa /
analyzed: ma mchis pa'i dus na gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub bskal pa grangs ma mchis par yang dag par bsgrubs pa nub par bgyid pa /
translated: in the future, will there be some monks who will cause the decline of the Tathāgata's enlightenment, which was accomplished over countless eons,

original: dge sbyong ma lags pa la dge sbyong du mchid kyis 'che zhing; tshangs par spyod pa ma lags par tshangs par spyod par mchid kyis 'che ba'i dge slong la la dag 'byung bar 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: dge sbyong ma lags pa la dge sbyong du mchid kyis 'che zhing; tshangs par spyod pa ma lags par tshangs par spyod par mchid kyis 'che ba'i dge slong la la dag 'byung bar 'gyur lags sam /
translated: and who will falsely claim to be spiritual practitioners, and falsely claim to be celibate, even though they are not true spiritual practitioners and do not lead celibate lives?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Mahā­kāśyapa,

original: 'od srung; nga dang / khyod dang / nyan thos chen po 'di dag kyang yongs su mya ngan 'das shing /
analyzed: 'od srung; nga dang / khyod dang / nyan thos chen po 'di dag kyang yongs su mya ngan 'das shing /
translated: Kāśyapa, I, you, and these great hearers will have passed into parinirvāṇa,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan du dong nas bstan pa 'di rab tu @263a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan du dong nas bstan pa 'di rab tu @263a *//
translated: and these bodhisattvas will have gone to other buddhafields.

original: 'jig par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The teaching will be destroyed,

original: tshig gis bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: tshig gis bstan par mi nus so //
translated: and it will not be possible to teach it with words.

original: 'od srung / de la dge slong lus ma bsgoms pa /
analyzed: 'od srung / de la dge slong lus ma bsgoms pa /
translated: Kāśyapa, there will be some monks who have not cultivated the body,

original: tshul khrims ma bsgoms pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims ma bsgoms pa /
translated: who have not cultivated discipline,

original: sems ma bsgoms pa /
analyzed: sems ma bsgoms pa /
translated: who have not cultivated the mind,

original: shes rab ma bsgoms pa /
analyzed: shes rab ma bsgoms pa /
translated: and who have not cultivated wisdom.

original: byis pa / dman pa /
analyzed: byis pa / dman pa /
translated: They will be childish, inferior,

original: glen pa / rmongs pa /
analyzed: glen pa / rmongs pa /
translated: foolish, confused,

original: rab tu ma zhi ba /
analyzed: rab tu ma zhi ba /
translated: unpeaceful,

original: ma dul ba kha cig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma dul ba kha cig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: and undisciplined.

original: de dag gi g-yo dang / sgyu dang / mi drang ba dang / gya gyu dang / dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / dge sbyong gi skyon rnams brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi g-yo dang / sgyu dang / mi drang ba dang / gya gyu dang / dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / dge sbyong gi skyon rnams brjod par bya'o //
translated: They will speak of the deceptions, deviousness, dishonesty, and crookedness of those who are pure in their practice of virtue, and of the faults of those who are pure in their practice of virtue.

original: 'od srung / de la dge sbyong gi dri ma rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srung / de la dge sbyong gi dri ma rnams gang zhe na /
translated: Kāśyapa, what are the impurities of those who are pure in their practice of virtue?

original: 'od srung / sum cu rtsa gnyis bo 'di dag ni dge sbyong gi dri ma ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / sum cu rtsa gnyis bo 'di dag ni dge sbyong gi dri ma ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, these thirty-two are the impurities of the spiritual practitioner.

original: de dag spangs na dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag spangs na dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
translated: If you abandon them, you are a spiritual practitioner, and you are called a spiritual practitioner.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the thirty-two?

original: 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / bdag la bstod pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / bdag la bstod pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang /
translated: The impurities of the spiritual practitioner are the conceptual thoughts of desire, the conceptual thoughts of malice, the conceptual thoughts of violence, the self-praise of the spiritual practitioner,

original: gzhan la brnyas pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / mi mthun pa'i rnyed pa kun du tshol ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / dad pas byin pa chud son pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang; ltung ba 'chab pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang /
analyzed: gzhan la brnyas pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / mi mthun pa'i rnyed pa kun du tshol ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / dad pas byin pa chud son pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang; ltung ba 'chab pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang /
translated: the disparagement of others, the impurity of the spiritual practitioner, the search for incompatible gains, the impurity of the spiritual practitioner, the desire to gain through gain, the impurity of the spiritual practitioner, the loss of what is given in faith, the impurity of the spiritual practitioner, the concealment of downfalls, the impurity of the spiritual practitioner,

original: khyim pa la brten pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / rab tu byung ba dang brten pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / 'du 'dzi la mngon par dga' ba dge @263b sbyong gi dri ma dang / rnyed pa yongs su ma grub par rtog pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang /🔽bdag gi rnyed pas chog par mi 'dzin pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / pha rol bsod snyoms rnyed pa la phrag dog dang ser sna byed pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / pha rol gyi rnyed pa la 'dod pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang /
analyzed: khyim pa la brten pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / rab tu byung ba dang brten pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / 'du 'dzi la mngon par dga' ba dge @263b sbyong gi dri ma dang / rnyed pa yongs su ma grub par rtog pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / bdag gi rnyed pas chog par mi 'dzin pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / pha rol bsod snyoms rnyed pa la phrag dog dang ser sna byed pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / pha rol gyi rnyed pa la 'dod pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang /
translated: The stains of a spiritual practitioner are: the stain of a spiritual practitioner who relies on householders, the stain of a spiritual practitioner who relies on monastics, the stain of a spiritual practitioner who delights in busyness, the stain of a spiritual practitioner who thinks about not having acquired gain,🔽the stain of a spiritual practitioner who is not satisfied with his own gain, the stain of a spiritual practitioner who is jealous and stingy about the alms gained by others, the stain of a spiritual practitioner who desires the gain of others,

original: bdag gi 'khrul pa la mi rtog pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / gzhan gyi 'khrul pa yongs su tshol ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / so sor thar pa dang 'dul ba mi srung ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / khva ltar mu cor smra ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang /
analyzed: bdag gi 'khrul pa la mi rtog pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / gzhan gyi 'khrul pa yongs su tshol ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / so sor thar pa dang 'dul ba mi srung ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / khva ltar mu cor smra ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang /
translated: the stain of a spiritual practitioner who does not investigate his own mistakes, the stain of a spiritual practitioner who seeks out the mistakes of others, the stain of a spiritual practitioner who does not guard the pratimokṣa and the vinaya, the stain of a spiritual practitioner who speaks nonsense like a crow,🔽and the stain of a spiritual practitioner who is not content with his own seat.

original: ma gus pa dang rgod pa dang khengs pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / lta bas kun nas dkris pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang 'gal ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / mthar lta ba la gnas pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang /
analyzed: ma gus pa dang rgod pa dang khengs pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / lta bas kun nas dkris pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang 'gal ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / mthar lta ba la gnas pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang /
translated: The stains of spiritual practitioners are disrespect, agitation, and conceit; the stains of spiritual practitioners are the entanglements of views; the stains of spiritual practitioners are discordant with dependent origination; the stains of spiritual practitioners are the views of the extremes;

original: 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par mi dga' ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i gsang tshig 'dzin pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / sgrib pas kun nas dkris pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang /
analyzed: 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par mi dga' ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i gsang tshig 'dzin pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / sgrib pas kun nas dkris pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang /
translated: the stains of spiritual practitioners are delighting in saṃsāra; the stains of spiritual practitioners are not delighting in nirvāṇa; the stains of spiritual practitioners are holding the secret words of the Lokāyatas; the stains of spiritual practitioners are the entanglements of obscurations;

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa dang 'gal ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyis skrag pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / chos zab mo spong ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / chos dang 'gal bar gnas pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa dang 'gal ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyis skrag pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / chos zab mo spong ba dge sbyong gi dri ma dang / chos dang 'gal bar gnas pa dge sbyong gi dri ma dang /
translated: The stains of mendicancy are to be in conflict with the ripening of karma, to be afraid of the three gates of liberation, to reject the profound Dharma, to live in contradiction to the Dharma,

original: dkon mchog gsum la mi gus pa dge sbyong gi dri ma ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la mi gus pa dge sbyong gi dri ma ste /
translated: and to be disrespectful to the Three Jewels.

original: 'od @264a *// srung; sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag ni dge sbyong gi dri ma ste /
analyzed: 'od @264a *// srung; sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag ni dge sbyong gi dri ma ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, these thirty-two are the stains of mendicancy.

original: de dag spangs na dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag spangs na dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
translated: If you abandon them, you are a mendicant.

original: 'od srung / brgyad po 'di dag ni dge sbyong gi chos kyi sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / brgyad po 'di dag ni dge sbyong gi chos kyi sgrib pa ste /
translated: “Kāśyapa, there are eight obscurations to the Dharma of mendicants.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bla ma rnams la mi gus pa dang / chos rnams la rim gro med pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / ma thos pa'i mdo sde spong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang /
analyzed: bla ma rnams la mi gus pa dang / chos rnams la rim gro med pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / ma thos pa'i mdo sde spong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang /
translated: They are disrespecting the gurus, not venerating the Dharma, improper mental activity, rejecting the sūtras that one has not heard, being afraid of the teachings on selflessness,🔽the absence of sentient beings,

original: srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa'i chos kyis skrag pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos bstan pa la mi 'jug gi 'dus byas nyid kyi rjes su snyeg pa dang / 'du byed rnams ma skyes pa zhes thos nas skrag pa dang /
analyzed: srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa'i chos kyis skrag pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos bstan pa la mi 'jug gi 'dus byas nyid kyi rjes su snyeg pa dang / 'du byed rnams ma skyes pa zhes thos nas skrag pa dang /
translated: the absence of life force, and the absence of persons, not engaging with the teachings on unconditioned phenomena but pursuing conditioned phenomena, being afraid when hearing that conditioned phenomena are unborn,

original: chos rnams rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa thos na g-yang sa chen por lhung ba bzhin du ltung ba ste /
analyzed: chos rnams rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa thos na g-yang sa chen por lhung ba bzhin du ltung ba ste /
translated: and when hearing that phenomena are naturally unborn, being terrified as if falling into a great abyss.

original: 'od srung / brgyad po 'di dag ni dge sbyong gi chos kyi sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / brgyad po 'di dag ni dge sbyong gi chos kyi sgrib pa ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, these eight are the obscurations to the Dharma of spiritual practitioners.

original: rab tu byung bas de dag yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung bas de dag yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: Monastics should abandon them.

original: 'od srung / dge sbyong gi kha dog dang rtags kyi dbyibs kyis dge sbyong zhes nga mi 'chad kyi /
analyzed: 'od srung / dge sbyong gi kha dog dang rtags kyi dbyibs kyis dge sbyong zhes nga mi 'chad kyi /
translated: Kāśyapa, I do not teach that someone is a monk just because of the color and shape of his robes.

original: yon tan gyi chos la nan tan byed pa'i dge sbyong ni dge sbyong zhes ngas bshad do //
analyzed: yon tan gyi chos la nan tan byed pa'i dge sbyong ni dge sbyong zhes ngas bshad do //
translated: I teach that someone is a monk who is diligent in the qualities of virtue.

original: 'od srung / dge sbyong gis ni rnyog pa med pa'i sems kyis lus la ngur smrig dag bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / dge sbyong gis ni rnyog pa med pa'i sems kyis lus la ngur smrig dag bcang bar bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, a monk should wear the saffron robes with a mind free of defilements.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'od srung / rnyog pa med pa la ngas ngur smrig gnang gi /
analyzed: 'od srung / rnyog pa med pa la ngas ngur smrig gnang gi /
translated: Kāśyapa, I allow the saffron robes for those who are free of defilements.

original: 'od srung / rnyog pa dang bcas pa'i @264b lus la ngur smrig dag 'chang ba de dag thams cad ni ngur smrig tshig pa'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'od srung / rnyog pa dang bcas pa'i @264b lus la ngur smrig dag 'chang ba de dag thams cad ni ngur smrig tshig pa'o zhes bshad de /
translated: Kāśyapa, I say that all those who wear the saffron robes with a defiled body are burning the saffron robes.

original: bsam pas mos pa rnams ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: bsam pas mos pa rnams ni ma gtogs so //
translated: This does not apply to those who are inspired by the intention.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because this is the banner of the noble ones.

original: skyo zhing 'dod chags dang bral bar spyod pa rnams kyis gos 'di dag ni nye bar zhi ba'i rjes su mthun pa byams pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: skyo zhing 'dod chags dang bral bar spyod pa rnams kyis gos 'di dag ni nye bar zhi ba'i rjes su mthun pa byams pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'o //
translated: Those who are disgusted and free from desire should wear these robes, which are in accord with complete peace and are in accord with love.

original: 'od srung / de la 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srung / de la 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan gang zhe na /
translated: “Kāśyapa, what is the banner of the noble ones?

original: 'od srung / bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan te /
analyzed: 'od srung / bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan te /
translated: Kāśyapa, there are twelve banners of the noble ones.

original: bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twelve?

original: 'od srung / tshul khrims 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / ting nge 'dzin 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / shes rab 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / rnam par grol ba 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang /
analyzed: 'od srung / tshul khrims 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / ting nge 'dzin 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / shes rab 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / rnam par grol ba 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang /
translated: Kāśyapa, the banner of the noble ones is morality, the banner of the noble ones is samādhi, the banner of the noble ones is wisdom, the banner of the noble ones is liberation, the banner of the noble ones is the vision of the wisdom of liberation, the banner of the noble ones is the knowledge of the exhaustion of defilements, the banner of the noble ones is the knowledge of nonarising, the banner of the noble ones is the knowledge of the path, the banner of the noble ones is the knowledge of the dhāraṇīs, the banner of the noble ones is the knowledge of the aggregates, the banner of the noble ones is the knowledge of the elements, and the banner of the noble ones is the knowledge of the sense bases.

original: bden pa la 'jug pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / bsam gtan bzhi 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / tshad med pa bzhi 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang /
analyzed: bden pa la 'jug pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / bsam gtan bzhi 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / tshad med pa bzhi 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang /
translated: The noble ones’ banner is to engage with the truth. The noble ones’ banner is to engage with dependent origination. The noble ones’ banner is the four concentrations. The noble ones’ banner is the four immeasurables.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / skyon med pa la 'jug pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / @265a *//
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / skyon med pa la 'jug pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan dang / @265a *//
translated: The noble ones’ banner is the four formless absorptions. The noble ones’ banner is to engage with flawlessness.

original: zag pa zad pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan te /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan te /
translated: The noble ones’ banner is the exhaustion of defilements.

original: 'od srung / bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan no //
analyzed: 'od srung / bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyal mtshan no //
translated: Kāśyapa, these twelve are the noble ones’ banner.

original: 'od srung / gang la la rgyal mtshan 'di dag dang mi ldan par 'phags pa'i rigs gos ngur smrig dag 'chang ba de ni nor ba'i chos la zhugs pa'o zhes ngas bshad do //
analyzed: 'od srung / gang la la rgyal mtshan 'di dag dang mi ldan par 'phags pa'i rigs gos ngur smrig dag 'chang ba de ni nor ba'i chos la zhugs pa'o zhes ngas bshad do //
translated: Kāśyapa, I say that anyone who does not possess these banners but wears the saffron robes of the noble ones is engaged in a mistaken Dharma.”🔽“

original: chos dang 'gal bar gnas pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: chos dang 'gal bar gnas pa zhes bshad do //
translated: He is said to be one who lives in contradiction to the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa las ring du gnas pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa las ring du gnas pa zhes bshad do //
translated: He is said to be one who lives far away from the teachings of the Tathāgata.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyogs kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnas pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyogs kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnas pa zhes bshad do //
translated: He is said to be one who lives in opposition to the side of nirvāṇa.

original: 'khor ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa zhes bshad do //
translated: He is said to be one who is on the side of saṃsāra.

original: nga rgyal gyi mchil pas zin pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi mchil pas zin pa zhes bshad do //
translated: He is said to be one who is caught in the net of pride.

original: snying po ma blangs pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: snying po ma blangs pa zhes bshad do //
translated: He is said to be one who has not taken out the essence.

original: chos las nyams pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: chos las nyams pa zhes bshad do //
translated: He is said to be one who has fallen from the Dharma.

original: nyam nga ba'i lam la gnas pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: nyam nga ba'i lam la gnas pa zhes bshad do //
translated: He is said to be one who lives on a dangerous path.

original: 'od srung / de lta bas na dge sbyong gi lus la ngur smrig dag 'chang ba na rnyog pa med pa'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / de lta bas na dge sbyong gi lus la ngur smrig dag 'chang ba na rnyog pa med pa'i sems su bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, therefore, when a monk wears the saffron robes on his body, he should have a mind that is free of disturbance.

original: gal te des 'bras bu thob par ma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te des 'bras bu thob par ma gyur na /
translated: If he does not attain the result,

original: de la gus pa brgyad kyis lus la ngur smrig dag bcang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la gus pa brgyad kyis lus la ngur smrig dag bcang bar bya ste /
translated: he should wear the saffron robes on his body with eight kinds of respect.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: mchod rten gyi 'du shes dang / ston pa'i 'du shes dang / nye bar zhi ba'i 'du shes dang / byams pa'i 'du shes dang / sangs rgyas la gus pa'i 'du shes dang / ngo tsha shes pa'i 'du shes dang / khrel yod pa'i 'du shes @265b dang; rnyog pa med par bya'o snyam pa ste /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi 'du shes dang / ston pa'i 'du shes dang / nye bar zhi ba'i 'du shes dang / byams pa'i 'du shes dang / sangs rgyas la gus pa'i 'du shes dang / ngo tsha shes pa'i 'du shes dang / khrel yod pa'i 'du shes @265b dang; rnyog pa med par bya'o snyam pa ste /
translated: the perception of the stūpa, the perception of the Teacher, the perception of peace, the perception of love, the perception of respect for the Buddha, the perception of shame, the perception of modesty, and the perception of being free from defilements.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul dang mthun pa'i gus pa brgyad po de dag gis lus la ngur smrig dag bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul dang mthun pa'i gus pa brgyad po de dag gis lus la ngur smrig dag bcang bar bya'o //
translated: One should wear the saffron robes with these eight kinds of respect that accord with the way of spiritual practice.

original: 'od srung / gang dag lhod cing yang dag par mi sdom pa dang / dge sbyong gi yon tan gyi chos 'di dag las nyams par lus la ngur smrig dag 'chang ba rnams mi gus pa 'di dag mi bskyed do //
analyzed: 'od srung / gang dag lhod cing yang dag par mi sdom pa dang / dge sbyong gi yon tan gyi chos 'di dag las nyams par lus la ngur smrig dag 'chang ba rnams mi gus pa 'di dag mi bskyed do //
translated: Kāśyapa, those who are lax, not restrained, and have fallen away from these qualities of spiritual practice, who wear the saffron robes but do not generate these kinds of respect,

original: 'od srung / dge sbyong gi kha dog dang gzugs can la gnod pa byed pa zhes bya ba nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba yod de /
analyzed: 'od srung / dge sbyong gi kha dog dang gzugs can la gnod pa byed pa zhes bya ba nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba yod de /
translated: Kāśyapa, there is a minor hell called “Harm to Those Who Have the Color and Form of Spiritual Practitioners.”

original: 'od srung / nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba der dge sbyong gi gzugs su gyur bzhin du; gos 'bar ba dag dang / mgo 'bar ba dag dang / lhung bzed 'bar ba dag dang / stan 'bar ba dag dang / mal cha 'bar ba dag gnod par byed de /
analyzed: 'od srung / nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba der dge sbyong gi gzugs su gyur bzhin du; gos 'bar ba dag dang / mgo 'bar ba dag dang / lhung bzed 'bar ba dag dang / stan 'bar ba dag dang / mal cha 'bar ba dag gnod par byed de /
translated: whose clothes, heads, alms bowls, seats, and bedding are all ablaze.

original: de dag gi longs spyod dang / yongs su spyad pa gang ci yod pa de dag thams cad 'bar /
analyzed: de dag gi longs spyod dang / yongs su spyad pa gang ci yod pa de dag thams cad 'bar /
translated: Whatever enjoyments and possessions they have are all ablaze,

original: rab tu 'bar te /
analyzed: rab tu 'bar te /
translated: burning fiercely,

original: kun du rab tu mched cing 'bar ba de mer gyur te /
analyzed: kun du rab tu mched cing 'bar ba de mer gyur te /
translated: and become a mass of flames.

original: dge sbyong kha dog dang gzugs kyis gnod pa de dag myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge sbyong kha dog dang gzugs kyis gnod pa de dag myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The monks, with their forms and colors, experience these torments.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su ma dag pa dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su ma dag pa dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why is this?🔽Because they are endowed with impure actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su ma dag pa dang ldan pa de dag gi 'gro ba yongs su ma dag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su ma dag pa dang ldan pa de dag gi 'gro ba yongs su ma dag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are endowed with impure actions of body, speech, and mind will have impure destinies.

original: 'od srung / dge sbyong ma yin pa la dge sbyong du khas 'che ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa la tshangs par spyod par khas @266a *//
analyzed: 'od srung / dge sbyong ma yin pa la dge sbyong du khas 'che ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa la tshangs par spyod par khas @266a *//
translated: Kāśyapa, those who are not ascetics but claim to be ascetics, who are not celibate but claim to be celibate,🔽

original: 'che ba gang zhig tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams dang / yon tan dang ldan pa rnams kyis phyag byas pa bdag gir byed na de mi dge ba'i las des brnyas pa brgyad 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'che ba gang zhig tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams dang / yon tan dang ldan pa rnams kyis phyag byas pa bdag gir byed na de mi dge ba'i las des brnyas pa brgyad 'thob ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, those who are not ascetics but claim to be ascetics, who are not celibate but claim to be celibate, and who appropriate the homage of those who are ethical and those who have good qualities will, due to that unwholesome action, obtain eight kinds of contempt.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: bems po lta bur 'gyur ba dang / go dka' zhing le lo can du 'gyur ba dang / skye bo mang pos brgal ba'i bud med du 'gyur ba dang; rang dbang med cing bran du 'gyur ba dang / mdog ngan cing mi sdug par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: bems po lta bur 'gyur ba dang / go dka' zhing le lo can du 'gyur ba dang / skye bo mang pos brgal ba'i bud med du 'gyur ba dang; rang dbang med cing bran du 'gyur ba dang / mdog ngan cing mi sdug par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will be like an inanimate object, difficult to understand and lazy, they will be a woman who is disputed by many people, they will be without independence and be a slave, they will be ugly and unattractive,

original: mdog ngan cing dbang chung grags par 'gyur ba dang / de la su yang bsu bar mi 'gyur ba dang / sbyin gnas rnams la mgu bar mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: mdog ngan cing dbang chung grags par 'gyur ba dang / de la su yang bsu bar mi 'gyur ba dang / sbyin gnas rnams la mgu bar mi byed pa ste /
translated: they will be ugly, weak, and have a bad reputation, no one will welcome them, and they will not please those who are worthy of offerings.

original: brnyas pa brgyad po 'di dag 'thob bo //
analyzed: brnyas pa brgyad po 'di dag 'thob bo //
translated: He will obtain these eight kinds of contempt.

original: 'od srung / de lta bas na bzang po ma yin pa'i chos 'di lta bu 'di dag thos nas dge sbyong sdig pa can gyis gzhan gyis phyag byas pa bdag gir mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / de lta bas na bzang po ma yin pa'i chos 'di lta bu 'di dag thos nas dge sbyong sdig pa can gyis gzhan gyis phyag byas pa bdag gir mi bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, therefore, when a sinful monk hears these kinds of bad teachings, he should not accept being worshipped by others.

original: 'od srung / dge sbyong ma yin pa la dge sbyong du khas 'che ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa la tshangs par spyod par khas 'che ba ni tha na sa chen po 'di la mchil ma'i thal ba tsam 'dor ba de yang rnyed par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'od srung / dge sbyong ma yin pa la dge sbyong du khas 'che ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa la tshangs par spyod par khas 'che ba ni tha na sa chen po 'di la mchil ma'i thal ba tsam 'dor ba de yang rnyed par mi 'gyur na /
translated: Kāśyapa, those who are not monks but claim to be monks, who are not celibate but claim to be celibate, will not even obtain as much as a drop of spit on the ground,

original: gom pa 'debs pa dang / 'jog pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gom pa 'debs pa dang / 'jog pa lta ci smos /

original: zhes khyod kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes khyod kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: mi gti mug pa de gnod pa ji tsam gyi phyir zhugs pa la ltos /

translated: Kāśyapa, therefore, a pure-hearted ascetic should completely abandon such things as the stains of an ascetic, the faults of an ascetic, the dishonesty of an ascetic, the deceit of an ascetic, the trickery of an ascetic, and the crookedness of an ascetic.

analyzed: 'od srung / dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni /

original: de'i phyir dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge sbyong dge sbyong zhes bya'o //

analyzed: 'od srung / dge slong dge slong zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong zhes bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, a monk is called a monk because he has conquered the afflictions.

analyzed: khye'ur 'du shes pa dang / bu mor 'du shes pa bcom pa ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong dge slong zhes bya'o //

original: lus bsgoms pa dang / tshul khrims bsgoms pa dang / sems bsgoms pa dang / shes rab bsgoms pa dang / 'jigs skrag pa med pa dang / srid pa'i chu bo las brgal ba dang / 'byung ba dang 'jig pa la lta ba dang / 'jigs pa thams cad las bral ba dang /

translated: They are those who have cultivated the body, who have cultivated discipline, who have cultivated the mind, who have cultivated wisdom, who are free from fear, who have crossed the river of existence, who have the view of emergence and destruction, who are free from all fear,

original: 'jigs pa med pa'i lam la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa'i lam la gnas pa ste /
translated: and who abide on the path of fearlessness.

original: de'i phyir dge slong dge slong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong dge slong zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called bhikṣus.

analyzed: 'od srung / gang la la zhig chos 'di dag dang mi ldan la bdag ni dge slong dge slong ngo snyam du khas 'che na /
translated: Kāśyapa, if someone does not have these qualities, but claims, “I am a monk, I am a monk,”

analyzed: bsam pas mos pa ma gtogs par nga yang de'i ston pa ma yin la /

analyzed: de yang nga'i nyan thos ma yin no //

analyzed: 'od srung / ya mtshan can dgu bcu rtsa lnga dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis ni nga'i bstan pa 'di nub par byed mi nus so //
translated: Kāśyapa, the ninety-five kinds of non-Buddhists and all the adversaries will not be able to cause my teaching to decline.

analyzed: gzhan du na nga'i bstan pa 'di las mi gti mug pa nges par mi sems pa gang dag 'byung ba de dag gis nga'i bstan pa nub bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Rather, those who are confused about my teaching, who do not think correctly, will cause my teaching to decline.

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / @269a *//

analyzed: ri dvags kyi rgyal po seng ge shi ba'i sha la gcan gzan nam /

original: bya gang gis kyang za bar mi nus kyi /
analyzed: bya gang gis kyang za bar mi nus kyi /

analyzed: seng ge'i ro de nyid las srin bu gang dag 'byung ba de dag ri dvags kyi rgyal po seng ge'i sha la za'o //

analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du nga'i bstan pa 'di nyid las mi blun po brkam pa chags pa'i zil gyis non pa chos ma yin pa la lta ba /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, in this very teaching of mine, there will be foolish people who are greedy, overcome by desire, who have views that are not the Dharma,

original: nges par mi sems pa /

analyzed: shi ba la re ba dang / byams pa med pa'i mig gis 'gro ba la lta ba dang / shi ba la dga' ba yin no //

original: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong gdol pa lta bu yang rtag tu mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang / slong ba ster ba'i khyim la gdu ba yin te /
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong gdol pa lta bu yang rtag tu mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang / slong ba ster ba'i khyim la gdu ba yin te /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, a mendicant who is like an outcast is always attached to the homes of friends and the homes of donors.

original: de nas rnyed pa dang bkur stis nye bar 'tsho zhing khyim pa de dag chos sam 'dul ba yang dag par 'dzin du mi 'jug pa dang / de rnyed pa'i ched du 'dris par byed kyi /
analyzed: de nas rnyed pa dang bkur stis nye bar 'tsho zhing khyim pa de dag chos sam 'dul ba yang dag par 'dzin du mi 'jug pa dang / de rnyed pa'i ched du 'dris par byed kyi /
translated: He lives off of his gains and honors, and he does not cause those householders to take up the Dharma or the monastic code. He associates with them for the sake of gain,

analyzed: don gyi ched du ma yin pa dang / mdza' ba'i sems med cing rtag tu rnyed pa la re ba yin te /

original: 'od srung / 'di ni dge sbyong gdol pa lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di ni dge sbyong gdol pa lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, this is called a mendicant who is like an outcast.

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na / gdol pa ni tshong dpon dang / khyim bdag dang / blon po dang / khams kyi rgyal po dag dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / grong rdal gyi mi dang / yul gyi mi rnams kyis rtag tu yongs su @272a *//
analyzed: dper na / gdol pa ni tshong dpon dang / khyim bdag dang / blon po dang / khams kyi rgyal po dag dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / grong rdal gyi mi dang / yul gyi mi rnams kyis rtag tu yongs su @272a *//
translated: For example, an outcast is always shunned by the guild masters, householders, ministers, regional lords, brahmins, kṣatriyas, city-dwellers, and country-folk.

original: spang bar bya ba'i 'os yin te /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i 'os yin te /

analyzed: gdol par rig nas thag ring po bas kyang ring por yongs su spang ngo //

analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong gdol pa lta bu yang; dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma tshul khrims dang ldan pa /
translated: Kāśyapa, likewise, the untouchable-like monk is worthy of being abandoned by monks, nuns, male and female lay followers who have ethical discipline,

analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa rnams kyis yongs su spong bar bya ba'i 'os yin te /

analyzed: dge sbyong gdol pa lta bu'i sdig pa'i chos kun du spyod cing tshul khrims 'chal par rig nas /

original: thag ring po bas kyang ring por yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: thag ring po bas kyang ring por yongs su spong ngo //
translated: Knowing this, he is to be abandoned even more than from afar.

analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste / dper na / gdol pa'i kha phyis sam /

analyzed: gos sam / yongs su spyad pa de dag thams cad la ni skye bo ya rabs rnams mi reg cing yongs su mi spyod do //
translated: such as their dishes, clothes, or possessions, are not touched or used by civilized people.

original: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong gdol pa lta bu'i lhung bzed dam /
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong gdol pa lta bu'i lhung bzed dam /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, the alms bowl,

analyzed: chos gos sam /
translated: robes,

analyzed: yongs su spyad pa thams cad ni mi mthun pa'i 'tsho bas yongs su btsal ba /
translated: and all the possessions of a śramaṇa who is like a fallen outcast are obtained through a livelihood that is not in accord with the Dharma,

original: lus dang / sems smras pas yongs su btsal ba yin pas /
analyzed: lus dang / sems smras pas yongs su btsal ba yin pas /

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa /

analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa dag de la mi reg cing mi spyod do //
translated: and good qualities do not touch them or make use of them.

analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / gdol pa ni kha phyis thogs te /
translated: For example, an outcaste carries a broom

analyzed: zhum zhum por byas nas gzhan gyi khyim du 'gro'o // 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong gdol pa lta bu yang zhum zhum por byas nas /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten @272b la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, a śramaṇa who is like a fallen outcaste goes to the stūpas of the Tathāgatas,🔽sweeping as he goes.

analyzed: zhum zhum por byas nas 'khor gyi nang du 'gro'o //

analyzed: zhum zhum por byas nas gtsug lag khang dang / gnas khang dang / gzhan gyi khyim du 'gro'o //

analyzed: 'od srung / de ltar na zhum zhum por byas pa /

original: sdig pa 'chab pa /
analyzed: sdig pa 'chab pa /

analyzed: de'i spyod lam gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni rung ba ma yin pa las yongs su brtags pa'o //
translated: All his actions are imagined to be improper.

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / gdol pa'i sems ni bde 'gro'i skye ba la mi gnas so //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar de rang gi las kyi nyes pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong gdol ba lta bu'i sems kyang bde 'gror 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir mi gnas shing /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, the mind of a caṇḍāla-like monk does not remain in order to go to a happy rebirth.

analyzed: de'i 'jig rten pha rol rnam par zhig la; de ngan 'gro gsum du gnas par sgrib pa med de /

original: 'od srung / 'di ni dge sbyong gdol pa lta bu zhes ba'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di ni dge sbyong gdol pa lta bu zhes ba'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, this is called a caṇḍāla-like monk.

original: 'od srung / de la dge sbyong rul pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srung / de la dge sbyong rul pa gang zhe na /

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: myang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: myang bar bya ba ma yin no //

analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong rul pa yang chos kyi mchog gi snying gu'i ro bro ba dang bral ba yin te /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, the rotten mendicant is devoid of the flavor of the best of the best of the Dharma.

analyzed: dri nga ba dang / yongs su spang bar bya ba'i 'os yin te / nyon mongs pa dang / g-yo sgyu 'dzin @273a *//
translated: He is foul-smelling and fit to be rejected.🔽He is stained by the bad smell of the afflictions, deceit, and grasping,

analyzed: pa dang / 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri mi zhim pa dang ldan zhing tshul khrims kyi dri dang bral ba yin /

original: nyon mongs pa'i dris bsgos pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dris bsgos pa yin te /

analyzed: de gang dang gang du 'gro ba de dang de nyid du yang bdag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs kyi /

original: gzhan la phan pa'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: not for the sake of others.

original: 'od srung / 'di ni dge sbyong rul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di ni dge sbyong rul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, this is called a rotten ascetic.

original: 'od srung; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung; 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / rul pa zhes bya ba ni gang zos pa dang / 'thungs pa dang / 'chos pa gzags pa de ni rul cing dri nga ba yin te /
translated: For example, rotten food, drink, and condiments are rotten and foul-smelling.

original: skye bo ya rabs thams cad kyis yongs su spang bar bya ba'i 'os yin no //
analyzed: skye bo ya rabs thams cad kyis yongs su spang bar bya ba'i 'os yin no //
translated: They are to be completely rejected by all holy people.

original: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong rul pa yang gzags pa dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong rul pa yang gzags pa dang mtshungs te /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, a rotten ascetic is like rotten food.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi kun tu spyod pa yongs su ma dag pas /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi kun tu spyod pa yongs su ma dag pas /
translated: Because his physical, verbal, and mental conduct is impure,

original: 'phags pa'i skye bos yongs su spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skye bos yongs su spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: he is to be completely rejected by holy people.

original: 'di ni dge sbyong rul pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dge sbyong rul pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called a rotten ascetic.

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / sa bon rul pa gang yin pa de ni sa chen po las skyer mi rung ngo //
translated: Rotten seeds cannot grow in the great earth.

original: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong rul pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa 'di la mi skye zhing /
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong rul pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa 'di la mi skye zhing /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, a rotten ascetic cannot grow in this teaching of the Buddha.

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnam par grol ba'i sa bon nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnam par grol ba'i sa bon nus pa ma yin la /
translated: The seeds of the noble dharmas are not able to grow.

original: 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: One will not attain the fruit.

original: 'od srung / 'di ni dge sbyong rul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di ni dge sbyong rul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, this is called a rotten mendicant.

original: 'od srung / de la dge sbyong za ma tog lta bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srung / de la dge sbyong za ma tog lta bu gang zhe na /
translated: “Kāśyapa, what is a mendicant who is like a box?

original: 'od srung / 'di @273b lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di @273b lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / za ma tog phyi rol shin tu byi dor byas la /
translated: For example, a box is very well polished on the outside,🔽but inside it is filled with various kinds of filth.

original: nad mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang ba zhig yod pa de bzhin du dge sbyong za ma tog lta bu yang dge sbyong ltar bcos shing phyi rol gtsang sbra spyod par gyur la /
analyzed: nad mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang ba zhig yod pa de bzhin du dge sbyong za ma tog lta bu yang dge sbyong ltar bcos shing phyi rol gtsang sbra spyod par gyur la /
translated: In the same way, a mendicant who is like a box pretends to be a mendicant and acts with external purity,

analyzed: nang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis yongs su gang ba yin te /
translated: but inside he is filled with desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: 'od srung / 'di ni dge sbyong za ma tog lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di ni dge sbyong za ma tog lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, this is called a mendicant who is like a box.

original: 'od srung / de la dge sbyong ku ran da ka lta bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srung / de la dge sbyong ku ran da ka lta bu gang zhe na /
translated: “Kāśyapa, what is a mendicant who is like a kuṇḍaka flower?

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dper na / ku ran da ka zhes bya ba'i me tog ni kha dog blta na sdug la reg na rtsub pa lci ba'i sbrang ma'i dri mnam zhing shi la bar ka'i rtsa ba'i dri mnam ste /
translated: For example, there is a flower called kurandaka. Its color is beautiful to behold, but if you touch it, it is rough and heavy. It smells like a bee, and it smells like the root of a bitter gourd.

original: mkhas pa mdzangs pa rnams ni me tog de lta bu la mi reg /
analyzed: mkhas pa mdzangs pa rnams ni me tog de lta bu la mi reg /
translated: The wise and the learned do not touch such a flower.

original: mi len / mi snom gyi /
analyzed: mi len / mi snom gyi /

analyzed: gang dag byis pa'i rang bzhin can du gyur pa de'i skyon mi shes pa de dag ni me tog de lta bu len cing snom mo //
translated: But those who are foolish by nature, who do not know its faults, they take such a flower and smell it.

analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong ku ran da ka lta bu yang dge sbyong gi kha dog dang / gzugs dang ldan par gyur kyang mi nges pa yin /
translated: “Kāśyapa, in the same way, there are also śramaṇas who are like the kurandaka flower. Even though they have the color and form of a śramaṇa, they are not definite.

original: tshig brlang ba yin /
analyzed: tshig brlang ba yin /
translated: They are coarse in speech.

original: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri mi zhim pa yin /
analyzed: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri mi zhim pa yin /

original: 'tsho ba nyams pa yin /🔽spyod pa nyams pa yin /
analyzed: 'tsho ba nyams pa yin / spyod pa nyams pa yin /
translated: They have a corrupt livelihood.🔽They have corrupt behavior.

original: lta ba nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: lta ba nyams pa yin te /

analyzed: mdzangs pa mkhas pa rnams ni ku ran da ka lta bu'i dge sbyong de lta bu la sten pa'am /
translated: The wise and learned rely on such a monk, who is like a kuranaga bird.

analyzed: snyen pa'am / bsnyen bkur mi byed kyi / de'i tshul rig pas thag ring po pas kyang ring por yongs su spong ngo // gang dag byis pa'i @274a *//
translated: The wise and the learned do not associate with, do not attend upon, and do not honor such a monk who is like a kuṇḍaka flower.

analyzed: rang bzhin can du gyur pa de dag ni ku ran da ka lta bu'i dge sbyong de lta bu la sten cing snyen la bsnyen bkur byed de /
translated: Those who are foolish by nature associate with, attend upon, and honor such a monk who is like a kuṇḍaka flower.

original: ku ran da ka'i me tog byis pa'i lag na 'dug pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ku ran da ka'i me tog byis pa'i lag na 'dug pa bzhin du /

original: de dang mthun pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa nyid du 'gyur te /

original: 'od srung / 'di ni ku ran da ka lta bu'i dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di ni ku ran da ka lta bu'i dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, this is called a monk who is like a kuṇḍaka flower.

original: 'od srung / de la chom rkun lta bu'i dge sbyong gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srung / de la chom rkun lta bu'i dge sbyong gang zhe na /
translated: Kāśyapa, what is a monk who is like a thief?

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na / mi g-yon can gyi rang bzhin can rtag tu brkam pa /
analyzed: dper na / mi g-yon can gyi rang bzhin can rtag tu brkam pa /
translated: for example, a person who is deceitful by nature, who is always greedy,

original: chags pa'i zil gyis non pa /
analyzed: chags pa'i zil gyis non pa /

original: bdag gi rnyed pas chog par mi 'dzin pa /
analyzed: bdag gi rnyed pas chog par mi 'dzin pa /

original: gzhan gyi nor la re ba drag shul can /
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor la re ba drag shul can /

original: dbyug pa dang / mtshon cha dang / dgra cha thogs pa /
analyzed: dbyug pa dang / mtshon cha dang / dgra cha thogs pa /
translated: They carry sticks, weapons, and other implements of violence.

original: ngo tsha med pa /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa /

original: snying rje med pa /
analyzed: snying rje med pa /
translated: They have no compassion.

original: rtag tu gdug cing rab tu gdug pa'i sems dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: rtag tu gdug cing rab tu gdug pa'i sems dang ldan pa ni /
translated: They are always cruel and violent.

original: de gang gi tshe /
analyzed: de gang gi tshe /
translated: When they enter

translated: will cause the teaching of the Blessed One, the Śākya Sage, to disappear.”🔽They will ridicule him and speak unpleasantly about him.🔽But the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, and gandharvas will feel great respect for those who are endowed with moral discipline

translated: Kāśyapa, those who are renunciant in this teaching of mine, but who are like thieves, do not give rise to even a single thought of disenchantment or of freedom from attachment.

original: 'bras bu 'thob pa lta ci smos kyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'thob pa lta ci smos kyi /

original: de ni gnas med do //

translated: Kāśyapa, these are called “those who are renunciant in this teaching of mine, but who are like thieves.”

original: 'od srung / de la dge sbyong shin te ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srung / de la dge sbyong shin te ma gang zhe na /

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong shin te ma yang /
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong shin te ma yang /

analyzed: yang zhing mthu chung la bdud kyis zin pa /

translated: Kāśyapa, the term “ascetic” is a designation for

analyzed: sdig pa can rnams kyi tshig bla dvags te /
translated: those who are immoral and sinful.🔽Kāśyapa, the term “ascetic” is a designation for

analyzed: nas la gnod pa zhig skyes nas /

analyzed: gang gi tshe nas kyi ljang bu las snye ma byung bar gyur pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong sun par byed pa'i dge slong /

analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi nang na 'dug pa yang tshul khrims dang ldan pa /

analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa rnams dang / kha dog dang rtags kyi dbyibs 'dra bas /
translated: Because of their similar color, marks, and shape,

analyzed: de la sbyin pa po dang / sbyin bdag de dag dge slong ngo snyam pa'i 'du shes skyed cing /

analyzed: sbyin gnas su 'du shes bskyed pa las /

original: de nas gal te /
analyzed: de nas gal te /

analyzed: mi gti mug pa / dge sbyong ma yin la dge sbyong du khas 'che ba /

analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ma yin la tshangs par spyod par khas 'che ba /

analyzed: nang rul cing zag pa de 'khor gyi nang nas byung ste /

analyzed: shi 'phos shing 'chi ba'i dus byas nas /

original: sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: they will go to the hells.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za lha'i mig dang ldan pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za lha'i mig dang ldan pa rnams kyis /
translated: gods, nāgas, yakṣas, and gandharvas who possess the divine eye

original: de sems can dmyal bar skye bar mthong ste /
analyzed: de sems can dmyal bar skye bar mthong ste /
translated: see him being born in the hells.

original: mthong nas kyang mi gti mug pa 'di ni sngon dge sbyong gi kha dog dang / gzugs kyis sdig pa'i las byas pas de sems can dmyal ba chen por skyes te /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang mi gti mug pa 'di ni sngon dge sbyong gi kha dog dang / gzugs kyis sdig pa'i las byas pas de sems can dmyal ba chen por skyes te /
translated: Having seen that, they say, ‘This deluded man, who previously had the color and form of a monk, committed evil deeds. He has been born in the great hells.

original: nas la gnod pa la nas @276a *//
analyzed: nas la gnod pa la nas @276a *//
translated: The rice has been destroyed, but the qualities of the rice are not destroyed.

original: kyi yon tan med pa ltar 'di la yang dge sbyong gi yon tan gyi 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: kyi yon tan med pa ltar 'di la yang dge sbyong gi yon tan gyi 'bras bu med do //
translated: In the same way, this man has no result from the qualities of a monk.’

original: zhes snying rje chen po skyed de /
analyzed: zhes snying rje chen po skyed de /
translated: They generate great compassion.

original: 'od srung / 'di ni dge sbyong sun par byed ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di ni dge sbyong sun par byed ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, this is called ‘corrupting a monk.’

original: 'od srung / de la dge sbyong ltar bcos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srung / de la dge sbyong ltar bcos pa gang zhe na /
translated: Kāśyapa, what is a counterfeit monk?

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na / ra gan chen po zhes bya ba'i lcags shig yod /🔽shin tu yongs su sbyang bar byang shing /
analyzed: dper na / ra gan chen po zhes bya ba'i lcags shig yod / shin tu yongs su sbyang bar byang shing /
translated: There is a metal called “great brass.”🔽If it is well refined

original: shin tu yongs su dag par byas na /
analyzed: shin tu yongs su dag par byas na /
translated: and well purified,

original: gser 'dra bar gyur te /
analyzed: gser 'dra bar gyur te /
translated: It is like gold.

original: 'on kyang gser gyi rin thang dang / gser gyi kha dog dang / bdar 'phro dang / srang la gzhal ba'i ljid 'dra ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gser gyi rin thang dang / gser gyi kha dog dang / bdar 'phro dang / srang la gzhal ba'i ljid 'dra ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the same as the value of gold, the color of gold, the luster of gold, or the weight of gold when weighed on a scale.

original: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong ltar bcos pa'i dge slong yang lus shin tu bkrus shing gos bzang po mdzes pa gyon la /
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge sbyong ltar bcos pa'i dge slong yang lus shin tu bkrus shing gos bzang po mdzes pa gyon la /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, a monk who is a fake ascetic has a very clean body and wears fine, beautiful clothes.

original: dge slong gi phyi rol gyi spyod pa thams cad yongs su dag ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi phyi rol gyi spyod pa thams cad yongs su dag ste /
translated: He is completely pure in all his external monk-like behavior.

original: 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / mdun du lta ba dang / g-yas g-yon lta ba dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / chos gos snam sbyar dang / lhung bzed dang / chos gos 'dzin pa shes bzhin du spyod kyang /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / mdun du lta ba dang / g-yas g-yon lta ba dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / chos gos snam sbyar dang / lhung bzed dang / chos gos 'dzin pa shes bzhin du spyod kyang /
translated: He walks, comes, looks in front, looks to the right and left, bends, stretches, and knows how to hold his Dharma robes, his patched robe, his bowl, and his Dharma robes.

original: de 'dod chags kyis bcom pa dang / zhe sdang gis bcom pa dang / gti mug gis bcom pa dang / nyon mongs pas bcom pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur stes bcom pa dang / nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang /
analyzed: de 'dod chags kyis bcom pa dang / zhe sdang gis bcom pa dang / gti mug gis bcom pa dang / nyon mongs pas bcom pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur stes bcom pa dang / nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang /
translated: They are destroyed by desire, destroyed by anger, destroyed by delusion, destroyed by afflictions, destroyed by gain and honor, destroyed by pride, destroyed by great pride,

original: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon @276b pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal gyis bcom pa dang / nyon mongs pas 'khol ba dang / bsnyen bkur lhur len gyi /
analyzed: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon @276b pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal gyis bcom pa dang / nyon mongs pas 'khol ba dang / bsnyen bkur lhur len gyi /
translated: destroyed by pride over pride, destroyed by the pride of thinking “I am,” destroyed by the pride of thinking “I am superior,” destroyed by the pride of thinking “I am a little bit inferior,” destroyed by the pride of thinking “I am not,” destroyed by the afflictions, and destroyed by being intent on service and honor.🔽They are not intent on the Dharma,

original: chos lhur mi len pa dang / lus che bar sbyor ba la brtson gyi /
analyzed: chos lhur mi len pa dang / lus che bar sbyor ba la brtson gyi /
translated: they are intent on applying themselves to great physical strength,

original: tshul khrims kyi che bar sbyor ba la mi brtson pa dang / zas dang gos lhur len gyi /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi che bar sbyor ba la mi brtson pa dang / zas dang gos lhur len gyi /
translated: but they are not intent on applying themselves to great moral discipline, they are intent on food and clothing,

original: 'phags pa'i chos lhur mi len pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol du kha na ma tho bas 'jigs par mi lta ba dang / tshe 'di lhur len gyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos lhur mi len pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol du kha na ma tho bas 'jigs par mi lta ba dang / tshe 'di lhur len gyi /
translated: They do not take the Dharma of the noble ones to heart, they do not fear the misdeeds that will lead to the next world, and they are intent on this life.

original: tshe phyi ma lhur mi len pa dang / lus gsob dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / grags pa la rten gyi /
analyzed: tshe phyi ma lhur mi len pa dang / lus gsob dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / grags pa la rten gyi /
translated: They do not take the next life to heart. They rely on the body, on gain, on honor, and on fame,

original: chos la rim gror bya ba la mi rten pa dang / spags pa sna tshogs kyis spags pa dang / sdig pas bsgos pa dang / khyim gyi las kyi mtha' la mngon par brtson pa dang / khyim pa dang mtshungs pa'i sems dang ldan pas /
analyzed: chos la rim gror bya ba la mi rten pa dang / spags pa sna tshogs kyis spags pa dang / sdig pas bsgos pa dang / khyim gyi las kyi mtha' la mngon par brtson pa dang / khyim pa dang mtshungs pa'i sems dang ldan pas /
translated: but they do not rely on the Dharma. They are honored with various kinds of wealth, they are tainted by evil, they are intent on household affairs, and they have a mind that is the same as that of householders.

original: bde ba dag gis kyang bde zhing /
analyzed: bde ba dag gis kyang bde zhing /
translated: They are happy when they are happy,

original: sdug bsngal dag gis kyang sdug bsngal ba dang / rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bas bcom pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dag gis kyang sdug bsngal ba dang / rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bas bcom pa yin te /
translated: and they are miserable when they are miserable. They are destroyed by attachment and anger.

original: de'i dge sbyong gi cho ga dang / spyod lam thams cad dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: de'i dge sbyong gi cho ga dang / spyod lam thams cad dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad ni /
translated: All their observances of the spiritual life, all their conduct, and all their mental states and thoughts

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du gzhol ba yin zhing /
