analyzed: 'od srung / de la dge slong mang du thos pa la mngon par brtson pa gang yin pa de dag la dge slong zhal ta byed pas lung nos shig /
translated: Kāśyapa, the monk who is the rector should give the reading transmission to those monks who are diligent in learning.

original: lhogs shig; kha ton gyis shig /
analyzed: lhogs shig; kha ton gyis shig /
translated: Read it! Recite it!

original: kho bo ni khyod kyi rim gro byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: kho bo ni khyod kyi rim gro byed pa yin gyi /
translated: I am your attendant.

original: khyod ji lta ji lta bur mang du thos par gyur pa de lta de lta bur dge slong gi dge 'dun mdzes par 'gyur bar gyis shig /
analyzed: khyod ji lta ji lta bur mang du thos par gyur pa de lta de lta bur dge slong gi dge 'dun mdzes par 'gyur bar gyis shig /
translated: You should study as much as possible so that the saṅgha of monks will be beautiful.

original: 'dug la brjod pas mdzes par gyis shig /
analyzed: 'dug la brjod pas mdzes par gyis shig /
translated: You should be beautiful through your speech.

original: bdag nyid kyi shes rab kyang mchog tu 'gyur bar gyis shig ces spro ba bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi shes rab kyang mchog tu 'gyur bar gyis shig ces spro ba bskyed par bya'o //
translated: You should be supreme through your wisdom.”

original: 'od srung / de la dge slong zhal ta byed pas de dag dus ma yin par gtang bar mi bya /
analyzed: 'od srung / de la dge slong zhal ta byed pas de dag dus ma yin par gtang bar mi bya /
translated: “Kāśyapa, the monk who is the rector should not assign them to do anything at the wrong time.

original: las su bsko bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: las su bsko bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not assign them to do work.

original: dge slong zhal ta byed pa des dge slong mang du thos pa de dag bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhal ta byed pa des dge slong mang du thos pa de dag bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: The monk who is the rector should protect those monks who are learned.

original: 'od srung / de la chos smra ba'i dge slong gang yin pa de dag dge slong zhal ta byed pas las su mi bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / de la chos smra ba'i dge slong gang yin pa de dag dge slong zhal ta byed pas las su mi bsko bar bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, the monk who is the rector should not assign to work the monks who are expounders of the Dharma.

original: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dag tu 'jug tu bcug la chos @280a *//🔽'chad du gzhug go /
analyzed: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dag tu 'jug tu bcug la chos @280a *// 'chad du gzhug go /
translated: He should have them enter the villages, towns, cities, countries, and royal palaces, and teach the Dharma.

original: chos nyan pa dag bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyan pa dag bsko bar bya'o //
translated: He should appoint listeners to the Dharma.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag par bya'o //🔽'bel ba'i chos kyi gtam gyi phyir /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag par bya'o // 'bel ba'i chos kyi gtam gyi phyir /
translated: He should purify the circle of the assembly.

original: dkyil 'khor du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: He should establish them in the maṇḍala for the sake of the Dharma talk.

original: chos smra ba'i dge slong la dge slong gang dag gnod pa byed pa'i dge slong de dag dge slong zhal ta byed pas bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: chos smra ba'i dge slong la dge slong gang dag gnod pa byed pa'i dge slong de dag dge slong zhal ta byed pas bzlog par bya'o //
translated: The monk who is the rector should ward off any monks who would harm the monk who is expounding the Dharma.

original: dge slong zhal ta byed pas chos smra ba'i dge slong la rtag tu bsu bar bya /
analyzed: dge slong zhal ta byed pas chos smra ba'i dge slong la rtag tu bsu bar bya /
translated: The monk who is the rector should always welcome the monk who is expounding the Dharma.

original: legs so zhes bya ba mang du bya'o //
analyzed: legs so zhes bya ba mang du bya'o //
translated: He should say “Excellent!” a lot.

original: 'od srung / de la dge slong gang dag 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin par gyur pa de dag gi gan du dge slong zhal ta byed pa de song la /
analyzed: 'od srung / de la dge slong gang dag 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin par gyur pa de dag gi gan du dge slong zhal ta byed pa de song la /
translated: Kāśyapa, the monk who is the rector should go to those monks who are upholders of the monastic code and upholders of the canon of discourses,

original: ji ltar na bdag rma med cing ma nyams pa dang / ji ltar na bdag ltung ba med pa'i chos kyis zhal ta bya zhes yongs su dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag rma med cing ma nyams pa dang / ji ltar na bdag ltung ba med pa'i chos kyis zhal ta bya zhes yongs su dri bar bya'o //
translated: “How can I be without wounds or breaks? How can I do service with a faultless Dharma?”

original: de nas 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa'i dge slong de dag gis dge slong zhal ta byed pa de'i bsam pa rig nas /
analyzed: de nas 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa'i dge slong de dag gis dge slong zhal ta byed pa de'i bsam pa rig nas /
translated: Then those monks who are Vinaya-holders and Sūtra-holders, having understood the intention of that monk who is the service-provider,

original: de'i bya ba dang / 'byung ba gang yin pa dang / byed pa gang yin pa de bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bya ba dang / 'byung ba gang yin pa dang / byed pa gang yin pa de bstan par bya'o //
translated: they should explain to him whatever his duties are, whatever his origins are, and whatever his actions are.

original: dge slong zhal ta byed pas 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa'i dge slong de dag la phangs bar bya ba dang / dad pa dang / gus pa dang / zhe sa rab tu bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhal ta byed pas 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa'i dge slong de dag la phangs bar bya ba dang / dad pa dang / gus pa dang / zhe sa rab tu bskyed par bya'o //
translated: The monk who is the service-provider should generate a sense of fondness, faith, respect, and deference for those monks who are Vinaya-holders and Sūtra-holders.

original: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa gang yin pa de dge slong zhal ta byed pas dus dus su dge slong gi dge 'dun la 'bul bar bya'i /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa gang yin pa de dge slong zhal ta byed pas dus dus su dge slong gi dge 'dun la 'bul bar bya'i /
translated: Whatever is the Saṅgha’s gain, that the monk who is the service-provider should offer to the Saṅgha of monks from time to time.

original: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa bsags shing sba bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa bsags shing sba bar mi bya ste /
translated: The Saṅgha’s gain should not be hoarded or hidden.

original: ji ltar @280b rnyed pa bzhin du sbyin par bya /
analyzed: ji ltar @280b rnyed pa bzhin du sbyin par bya /
translated: One should give according to one’s ability.

original: ma bskul bar sbyin par bya /
analyzed: ma bskul bar sbyin par bya /
translated: One should give without being asked.

original: gnod pa med par sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa med par sbyin par bya'o //
translated: One should give without harming others.

original: des 'dun pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / 'jigs pas 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: des 'dun pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / 'jigs pas 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not go out of desire, hatred, confusion, or fear.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun la rton par bya'i /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun la rton par bya'i /
translated: One should rely on the Saṅgha of monks,

original: khyim pa'i phyogs la rton par mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs la rton par mi bya'o //
translated: not on the side of the laity.

original: dge 'dun gyi bya ba la rton par bya'i /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi bya ba la rton par bya'i /
translated: One should rely on the activities of the Saṅgha,

original: bdag gi bya ba la rton par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi bya ba la rton par mi bya'o //
translated: not on one’s own activities.

original: dngos po gang la yang dbang bya ba'i 'du shes bskyed par mi bya'i /
analyzed: dngos po gang la yang dbang bya ba'i 'du shes bskyed par mi bya'i /
translated: One should not develop the notion that one has control over any object.

original: bya ba ci tsam du chung ba yang dge 'dun gyi gros bzhin bya zhing rang dgar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba ci tsam du chung ba yang dge 'dun gyi gros bzhin bya zhing rang dgar mi bya'o //
translated: Even in the smallest matter, one should act in accordance with the Saṅgha’s decision, not as one wishes.

original: dge 'dun gyi'am /🔽phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi'am / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi'am /
translated: One should not mix together the property of the Saṅgha,🔽the property of the Saṅgha of the four directions,

original: mchod rten gyi yo byad gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi yo byad gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: or the property of a stūpa.

original: ci lta ba bzhin du gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: ci lta ba bzhin du gzhag par bya ste /
translated: One should keep them as they are.

original: dge 'dun gyi phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi dang bsre bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi dang bsre bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not mix the property of the Saṅgha of the four directions with the property of the Saṅgha.

original: phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa yang dge 'dun gyi dang bsre bar mi bya'o; ;dge 'dun gyi dang phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa mchod rten gyi dang bsre bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa yang dge 'dun gyi dang bsre bar mi bya'o; ;dge 'dun gyi dang phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa mchod rten gyi dang bsre bar mi bya'o //
translated: The offerings to the Saṅgha of the four directions should not be mixed with the offerings to the Saṅgha.🔽The offerings to the Saṅgha and the offerings to the Saṅgha of the four directions should not be mixed with the offerings to the stūpa.🔽The offerings to the stūpa should not be mixed with the offerings to the Saṅgha and the offerings to the Saṅgha of the four directions.

original: mchod rten gyi rnyed pa yang dge 'dun gyi dang / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi dang bsre bar mi bya'o; ;gal te phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la brel phongs su gyur la /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi rnyed pa yang dge 'dun gyi dang / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi dang bsre bar mi bya'o; ;gal te phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la brel phongs su gyur la /
translated: If the Saṅgha of the four directions is in need,

original: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa che bar gyur na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa che bar gyur na /
translated: and the offerings to the Saṅgha are abundant,

original: dge slong zhal ta byed pas dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdus la /
analyzed: dge slong zhal ta byed pas dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdus la /
translated: the monk in charge should gather the Saṅgha of monks

original: gros mthun par bgyis te /
analyzed: gros mthun par bgyis te /
translated: and discuss it together.

original: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa de las phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la shugs par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa de las phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la shugs par bya'o //
translated: From the offerings to the Saṅgha, they should be distributed to the Saṅgha of the four directions.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten zhig ral du gyur la /🔽dge 'dun gyi dang / phyogs bzhi'i @281a *//
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten zhig ral du gyur la / dge 'dun gyi dang / phyogs bzhi'i @281a *//
translated: If the stūpa of the Tathāgata is dilapidated,

original: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa che bar gyur na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa che bar gyur na /
translated: and the offerings to the Saṅgha and the offerings to the Saṅgha of the four directions are abundant,🔽 Translation: 四方僧利不得合入。🔽四方僧利不得入四方僧。🔽若四方僧有急施衣。🔽應分此衣。🔽若四方僧有現前僧。🔽若四方僧有現前僧。

original: dge slong zhal ta byed pas dge slong gi dge 'dun thams cad bsdus la /
analyzed: dge slong zhal ta byed pas dge slong gi dge 'dun thams cad bsdus la /
translated: The monk in charge should gather the entire saṅgha of monks.

original: gros mthun par bgyis te /
analyzed: gros mthun par bgyis te /
translated: They should agree unanimously and say,

original: 'di skad ces de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten 'di ni zhig ral du gyur la /
analyzed: 'di skad ces de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten 'di ni zhig ral du gyur la /
translated: ‘This stūpa of the Tathāgata is dilapidated.

original: dge 'dun gyi dang / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa ni che bar gyur na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dang / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa ni che bar gyur na /
translated: The saṅgha and the gains of the saṅgha of the four directions are great.

original: gal te tshe dang ldan pa rnams gnod pa med cing /
analyzed: gal te tshe dang ldan pa rnams gnod pa med cing /
translated: If the venerable ones have no objection,

original: dad pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan la /
translated: if they have faith,

original: bzod cing gnang na bdag gis dge 'dun gyi dang / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa 'di las dngos po cung zad cig khyer te /
analyzed: bzod cing gnang na bdag gis dge 'dun gyi dang / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa 'di las dngos po cung zad cig khyer te /
translated: if they are patient and agree, I will take a little from the saṅgha and the gains of the saṅgha of the four directions

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten 'di bcos par bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten 'di bcos par bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: and repair this stūpa of the Tathāgata.’

original: gal te dge 'dun gyis gnang na /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyis gnang na /
translated: If the saṅgha agrees,

original: dge slong zhal ta byed pa des de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhal ta byed pa des de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: the monk in charge should do it that way.

original: ci ste dge 'dun gyis ma gnang na /
analyzed: ci ste dge 'dun gyis ma gnang na /
translated: But if the saṅgha does not agree,

original: dge slong zhal ta byed pa des sbyin pa po dang / sbyin bdag rnams la gsol ba thob la /
analyzed: dge slong zhal ta byed pa des sbyin pa po dang / sbyin bdag rnams la gsol ba thob la /
translated: That monk administrator should request the donors and benefactors,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gso bar bya'o //
translated: and then repair the stūpa of the Tathāgata.

original: 'od srung / gal te mchod rten gyi rnyed pa ji ltar mang du gyur du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'od srung / gal te mchod rten gyi rnyed pa ji ltar mang du gyur du zin kyang /
translated: “Kāśyapa, even if the gains of the stūpa are many,

original: dge slong zhal ta byed pas dge 'dun dang / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la bshugs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhal ta byed pas dge 'dun dang / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la bshugs par mi bya'o //
translated: the monk administrator should not appropriate them for the saṅgha or for himself.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dad cing dang ba mang po dag gis mchod rten la phul ba ni tha na ras kyi kha tsar gcig tsam gang yin pa de yang lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mchod rten yin na /🔽rin po che'am /
analyzed: dad cing dang ba mang po dag gis mchod rten la phul ba ni tha na ras kyi kha tsar gcig tsam gang yin pa de yang lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mchod rten yin na / rin po che'am /
translated: Whatever is offered to the stūpa by many faithful and pure people, even if it is just a single piece of cotton, is a stūpa for the world with its gods.🔽What need is there to mention precious things

original: rin po cher smos pa dag lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: rin po cher smos pa dag lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: or things considered precious?🔽“Whatever is offered to the stūpa as cloth should be used to make robes for the stūpa of the Tathāgata.

original: mchod @281b rten la gos phul ba gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten de nyid du rlung dang nyi ma dang / char pas dengs kyang bla'i /
analyzed: mchod @281b rten la gos phul ba gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten de nyid du rlung dang nyi ma dang / char pas dengs kyang bla'i /
translated: Even if it is destroyed by wind, sun, and rain,

original: mchod rten la phul ba'i gos dbyig gam /
analyzed: mchod rten la phul ba'i gos dbyig gam /
translated: He should not sell the cloth offered to the stūpa for money,

original: dbyig gi rin du bsgyur bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dbyig gi rin du bsgyur bar mi bya'o //
translated: nor should he exchange it for something else.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mchod rten gyi ni rin thang cung zad kyang med la mchod rten ni cis kyang brel ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi ni rin thang cung zad kyang med la mchod rten ni cis kyang brel ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: The stūpa has no need for anything, and the stūpa has no debts.

original: 'od srung / dge slong zhal ta byed pas de ltar yongs su dag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / dge slong zhal ta byed pas de ltar yongs su dag par bya ste /
translated: “ Kāśyapa, the monk who is the steward should act in this way,

original: des dkon mchog gsum gyi dang ma sbags par bya'o //
analyzed: des dkon mchog gsum gyi dang ma sbags par bya'o //
translated: and he should not mix up the property of the Three Jewels.

original: bdag gi rnyed pas chog shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rnyed pas chog shes par bya'o //
translated: He should be satisfied with his own property.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i dngos po rnams la bdag gi 'du shes mi bya'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i dngos po rnams la bdag gi 'du shes mi bya'o //
translated: He should not think of the property blessed by the Three Jewels as his own.

original: 'od srung / dge slong zhal ta byed pa rab tu sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa gang la la zhig gis tshul khrims dang ldan pa /🔽yon tan dang ldan pa /🔽spyin gnas rnams la sems khros sam /
analyzed: 'od srung / dge slong zhal ta byed pa rab tu sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa gang la la zhig gis tshul khrims dang ldan pa / yon tan dang ldan pa / spyin gnas rnams la sems khros sam /
translated: “ Kāśyapa, if a monk who is a steward, who is full of hatred,

original: dbang byed cing bsgo blag byed na /
analyzed: dbang byed cing bsgo blag byed na /
translated: is angry with, or domineering toward, or gives orders to,🔽those who are endowed with moral discipline,🔽those who are endowed with good qualities,🔽those who are worthy of offerings,

original: de mi dge ba'i las des sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mi dge ba'i las des sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to that unwholesome action, they will go to the hells.

original: gal te mi'i 'jig rten du 'ongs na yang bran dang gzhan gyi las byed par 'gyur ba dang / khu tshur dang / thal lcags dang / lag cha snyems pas brdegs pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi'i 'jig rten du 'ongs na yang bran dang gzhan gyi las byed par 'gyur ba dang / khu tshur dang / thal lcags dang / lag cha snyems pas brdegs pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if they come to the human world, they will be servants and slaves, and will encounter beatings with fists, sticks, and weapons.

original: 'od srung / gzhan yang dge slong zhal ta byed pa dge 'dun gyi bya ba las 'das te /
analyzed: 'od srung / gzhan yang dge slong zhal ta byed pa dge 'dun gyi bya ba las 'das te /
translated: “Kāśyapa, moreover, if a monk who is in charge transgresses the duties of the saṅgha,

original: rang dgar dge slong rnams la dbang byed cing /
analyzed: rang dgar dge slong rnams la dbang byed cing /
translated: and acts independently, controlling the monks,

original: bsgo ba dang / chad pas gcod pa dang / 'jigs par byed pa dang / bsdigs pa dang / dus @282a *//
analyzed: bsgo ba dang / chad pas gcod pa dang / 'jigs par byed pa dang / bsdigs pa dang / dus @282a *//
translated: and if he orders them, punishes them, threatens them, intimidates them,🔽and sends them on errands and gives them orders at inappropriate times,

original: ma yin par mngag pa dang / dus ma yin par bsgo ba byed na de mi dge ba'i las des nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba phur pa mang po zhes bya ba der skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma yin par mngag pa dang / dus ma yin par bsgo ba byed na de mi dge ba'i las des nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba phur pa mang po zhes bya ba der skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: due to that unwholesome action he will be reborn in the ephemeral hell called ‘Many Stakes.’

original: der skyes nas lus la lcags phur brgya stong zug cing /🔽de dag 'bar /
analyzed: der skyes nas lus la lcags phur brgya stong zug cing / de dag 'bar /
translated: Once born there, hundreds of thousands of iron stakes will pierce his body.🔽They will be burning,

original: rab tu 'bar la /
analyzed: rab tu 'bar la /
translated: blazing,

original: kun du rab tu mched cing 'bar 'gyur ro //🔽des tshul khrims dang ldan pa /
analyzed: kun du rab tu mched cing 'bar 'gyur ro // des tshul khrims dang ldan pa /
translated: and it will spread and blaze.🔽“He will be threatened by those who are endowed with discipline,

original: yon tan dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa /
translated: those who are endowed with good qualities,

original: sbyin gnas rnams la bsdigs shing /

translated: alms,🔽medicines,

analyzed: zhal ta byed pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o ////

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

translated: “Kāśyapa, in this regard, a monk who is a wilderness dweller should set up his dwelling place in a wilderness, a forest, or a remote place,🔽where there are no thieves, no cowherds, no shepherds,

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /

analyzed: dgon par dgon pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs te gnas par bya ba dang / chos kyi 'tsho bas 'tsho'i /

analyzed: yid la bya ba brgyad po de dag bskyed nas /

original: de dgon pa'i gnas de na gnas pa na /

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /

analyzed: phan pa'i byams pa dang / bde ba'i byams pa dang / gnod pa med pa'i byams pa dang / yang dag pa'i byams pa dang / tha dad pa med pa'i byams pa dang / zhi gnas kyi byams pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i byams pa dang /
translated: the love of benefit, the love of happiness, the love of nonviolence, the love of truth, the love of nondifferentiation, the love of tranquility, the love of certainty in the Dharma,

original: bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i byams pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i byams pa ste /
translated: and the love of pure intention.

original: sems can thams cad la byams pa brgyad po de dag bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byams pa brgyad po de dag bskyed par bya'o //
translated: “One should generate these eight kinds of love toward all sentient beings.

original: de dgon pa'i gnas de na gnas pa na /
analyzed: de dgon pa'i gnas de na gnas pa na /
translated: While dwelling in that solitary place,

original: 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ni lam ring po nas 'dir 'ongs @284a *//
translated: ‘I have come here from a long way away.

original: la; gcig pu gnyis su med pa ste /🔽legs par byas pa'am /
analyzed: la; gcig pu gnyis su med pa ste / legs par byas pa'am /
translated: I am alone, without a companion.🔽There is no one to encourage me to do what is good

analyzed: nyes par byas pa skul ba'i grogs ni gang yang med kyi /
translated: or to warn me about what is bad.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bdag gi sems kyi bsam pa shes pa dag yod de /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bdag gi sems kyi bsam pa shes pa dag yod de /
translated: There are gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, and blessed buddhas who know my thoughts.

original: bdag dgon pa'i gnas na gnas la /
analyzed: bdag dgon pa'i gnas na gnas la /
translated: I live in a monastery,

original: mi dge ba'i sems kyi dbang du song na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems kyi dbang du song na /
translated: but if I fall under the power of unwholesome thoughts,

original: de dag dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: I will be under their power.

original: bdag lam ring po nas 'ongs shing gcig pu gnyis su med de /
analyzed: bdag lam ring po nas 'ongs shing gcig pu gnyis su med de /
translated: I have come from far away, alone, without a companion,

original: rten pa med /
analyzed: rten pa med /
translated: without support,

original: bdag gi med /
analyzed: bdag gi med /
translated: without a self,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med la /🔽gal te 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med la / gal te 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog /
translated: without anything to hold on to.🔽If I think about sensual pleasures,🔽if I think about malice,

original: gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog /🔽'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog /
analyzed: gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog / 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog /
translated: if I think about violence,

original: mi dge ba gzhan la rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog par gyur na /
analyzed: mi dge ba gzhan la rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog par gyur na /
translated: or if I think about other unwholesome things,

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / 'du ba la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams dang bye brag med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / 'du ba la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams dang bye brag med par 'gyur te /
translated: I will be no different from sentient beings who cling to a self and who delight in gathering.

original: bdag gis lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za rnams la bslus par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bdag gis lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za rnams la bslus par 'gyur zhing /
translated: I will have deceived the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, and gandharvas,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mi ma nyes par byas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mi ma nyes par byas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: and I will have failed the blessed buddhas.

original: ci nas kyang bdag la lha rnams 'phya bar mi 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang dgyes par 'gyur ba de @284b ltar bya'o //
analyzed: ci nas kyang bdag la lha rnams 'phya bar mi 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang dgyes par 'gyur ba de @284b ltar bya'o //
translated: I will act in such a way that the gods do not reproach me, and that the Blessed Buddhas are pleased.’

original: snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: “He should generate this thought.

original: de dgon pa'i gnas de na gnas pa na /
analyzed: de dgon pa'i gnas de na gnas pa na /
translated: When he is living in that solitary place,

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdam par bya /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdam par bya /
translated: he should be bound by the vow of individual liberation.

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po shin tu kun bsrung bar bya /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po shin tu kun bsrung bar bya /
translated: He should be a guardian of the entire aggregate of morality.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / kha gsag med pa dang / 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sems mngon du bya ba dang / ci ltar thos pa'i chos la rten pa dang /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / kha gsag med pa dang / 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sems mngon du bya ba dang / ci ltar thos pa'i chos la rten pa dang /
translated: He should be pure in body, speech, and mind, without hypocrisy or boasting, with pure livelihood, with the mind directed toward concentration, and with the practice of the Dharma as he has heard it.

original: tshul bzhin yid la bya ba dang rab tu ldan pa dang / yid byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba dang / 'khor bas 'jigs skrag pa dang / phung po ni gshed ma ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la bya ba dang rab tu ldan pa dang / yid byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba dang / 'khor bas 'jigs skrag pa dang / phung po ni gshed ma ste /
translated: It is to be endowed with proper mental attention. It is to be disgusted, free from attachment, and to cease. It is to be inclined toward nirvāṇa. It is to be terrified of saṃsāra. It is to know the aggregates to be executioners.

original: phyir rgol bar rig pa dang / khams bzhi la myur du gdug pa'i dug tu 'du shes pa dang / skye mched drug la grong stong ltar mos pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar 'jug par mkhas pa dang / rtag pa dang / chad par lta ba yongs su spang ba dang /
analyzed: phyir rgol bar rig pa dang / khams bzhi la myur du gdug pa'i dug tu 'du shes pa dang / skye mched drug la grong stong ltar mos pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar 'jug par mkhas pa dang / rtag pa dang / chad par lta ba yongs su spang ba dang /
translated: It is to perceive the four elements as a swift and virulent poison. It is to be intent on the six sense bases as an empty village. It is to be skilled in engaging in dependent origination. It is to abandon the views of eternalism and nihilism.

original: sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gso ba med pa dang / gang zag med par rnam par spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid la mos pa dang / mtshan ma med pa spyod yul ba dang / smon pa med pa'i sems spel ba dang /
analyzed: sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gso ba med pa dang / gang zag med par rnam par spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid la mos pa dang / mtshan ma med pa spyod yul ba dang / smon pa med pa'i sems spel ba dang /
translated: It is to engage in the practice of the absence of sentient beings, the absence of life force, the absence of a life-sustaining principle, and the absence of a person. It is to be intent on emptiness. It is to have the sphere of activity of signlessness. It is to increase the mind of wishlessness.

original: khams gsum la rtag tu 'jigs pa'i yid dang ldan pa dang / rtag tu mgo dang / gos la me 'bar pa @285a *//
analyzed: khams gsum la rtag tu 'jigs pa'i yid dang ldan pa dang / rtag tu mgo dang / gos la me 'bar pa @285a *//
translated: They are always fearful of the three realms, and they are like someone whose head or clothes are on fire.🔽

original: bzhin du brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / brtson pa mi 'dor ba dang / lus kyi skyon la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa dang / sems kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa la lta ba dang / sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa la mngon par brtson pa dang /
analyzed: bzhin du brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / brtson pa mi 'dor ba dang / lus kyi skyon la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa dang / sems kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa la lta ba dang / sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa la mngon par brtson pa dang /
translated: They are those who are constantly terrified of the three realms, who are constantly diligent like a head or clothing on fire, who do not give up their diligence, who discern the faults of the body as they truly are, who observe the arising and destruction of the mind, who are diligent in fully understanding suffering,

original: kun 'byung ba thams cad kyi sred pa spang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba la zhugs pa dang / lam bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang / phyi'i spyod yul dran pa nye bar bzhag pa la rab tu gnas pa dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba thams cad kyi sred pa spang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba la zhugs pa dang / lam bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang / phyi'i spyod yul dran pa nye bar bzhag pa la rab tu gnas pa dang /
translated: who abandon craving for all that arises, who are engaged in the realization of cessation, who are diligent in the yoga of cultivating the path, who abide in the mindfulness of external objects,

original: mi dge ba'i chos dang bral ba dang / dge ba'i chos la mngon du phyogs pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba la shin tu gnas pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa mngon du gyur pa dang / dbang po lnga dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos dang bral ba dang / dge ba'i chos la mngon du phyogs pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba la shin tu gnas pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa mngon du gyur pa dang / dbang po lnga dang ldan pa dang /
translated: They are free from nonvirtuous qualities, they are oriented toward virtuous qualities, they are well established in the correct abandonments, they have realized the bases of miraculous power, they possess the five faculties,

original: stobs lnga'i shugs dang ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la bsam gtan pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la mngon par brtson pa dang / zhi gnas la gnas pa dang / lhag mthong gis blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: stobs lnga'i shugs dang ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la bsam gtan pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la mngon par brtson pa dang / zhi gnas la gnas pa dang / lhag mthong gis blta bar bya ste /
translated: they possess the strength of the five powers, they contemplate the seven branches of enlightenment, they strive in the eightfold path of the noble ones, they abide in śamatha, and they look with vipaśyanā.

original: 'od srung / de lta bu'i go cha 'di dag bgos nas /
analyzed: 'od srung / de lta bu'i go cha 'di dag bgos nas /
translated: Kāśyapa, having donned such armor,

original: nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal zhing rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang / rtag tu khyad par du 'gro bar dgon pa'i gnas de la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal zhing rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang / rtag tu khyad par du 'gro bar dgon pa'i gnas de la gnas par bya'o //
translated: they should abide in that solitary place, where they do not sleep during the first and last periods of the night, but strive in practice, and always progress.

original: de dgon pa'i gnas de na gnas pa na /
analyzed: de dgon pa'i gnas de na gnas pa na /
translated: While they are abiding in that solitary place,

original: lus brgyan par sbyor ba la brtson par mi bya'o //🔽mal chas brgyan pa la brtson bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: lus brgyan par sbyor ba la brtson par mi bya'o // mal chas brgyan pa la brtson bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not strive to adorn his body.🔽He should not strive to adorn his bed.

original: chos gos @285b kyis brgyan pa la brtson par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos @285b kyis brgyan pa la brtson par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not strive to adorn his robes.

original: des rtsva rnying pa skams pa blangs la 'chag sa dang / 'dug sar legs par bting ste /
analyzed: des rtsva rnying pa skams pa blangs la 'chag sa dang / 'dug sar legs par bting ste /
translated: He should take old, dry grass and spread it out well on his walking path and his sitting place.

original: bdag 'dug pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dang / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi dang / ma spags pa dang / bdag gi gos kyis chog shes par dgon pa'i gnas der gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag 'dug pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dang / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi dang / ma spags pa dang / bdag gi gos kyis chog shes par dgon pa'i gnas der gnas par bya'o //
translated: He should be content with his own robes, and he should live in that wilderness dwelling.

original: 'od srung / dge slong dgon pa gang gi tshe /
analyzed: 'od srung / dge slong dgon pa gang gi tshe /
translated: Kāśyapa, when a monk who is in the wilderness🔽enters a village, town, or city for alms,

original: lus gso ba dang / 'phags pa'i lam nye bar brtan pa'i phyir grong ngam /🔽grong khyer ram /
analyzed: lus gso ba dang / 'phags pa'i lam nye bar brtan pa'i phyir grong ngam / grong khyer ram /
translated: he should do so in order to nourish his body and to stabilize the noble path.

original: grong rdal du bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'jug pa na /
analyzed: grong rdal du bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'jug pa na /
translated: When he goes to the village, town, or city for alms,

original: des sems 'di lta bus dgon pa'i gnas de nas 'gro bar bya ste /
analyzed: des sems 'di lta bus dgon pa'i gnas de nas 'gro bar bya ste /
translated: he should do so with the following attitude:

original: ma rnyed kyang yongs su yi chad par mi bya /
analyzed: ma rnyed kyang yongs su yi chad par mi bya /
translated: ‘Even if I do not get anything, I will not be discouraged.

original: rnyed kyang dga' ba bskyed par mi bya /
analyzed: rnyed kyang dga' ba bskyed par mi bya /
translated: Even if you do find them, do not be pleased.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa yid la bya /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa yid la bya /
translated: You should keep in mind the ripening of karma.

original: bsod nams nye bar brtan par bya /
analyzed: bsod nams nye bar brtan par bya /
translated: You should be firmly established in merit.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yid la bya ba bsam zhing des grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal du bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yid la bya ba bsam zhing des grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal du bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'jug par bya'o //
translated: You should think about the Tathāgata, and thus enter the village, town, or city for alms.

original: de grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal du bsod snyoms spyod pa na /
analyzed: de grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal du bsod snyoms spyod pa na /
translated: “When you are going for alms in the village, town, or city,

original: chos kyi go cha bgos la; bsod snyoms spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi go cha bgos la; bsod snyoms spyad par bya'o //
translated: you should don the armor of the Dharma and go for alms.

original: de la chos kyi go cha gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos kyi go cha gang zhe na /
translated: What is the armor of the Dharma?

original: mig gis yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams mthong na /
analyzed: mig gis yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams mthong na /
translated: When you see pleasant forms with your eyes,

original: rjes su chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags par mi bya'o //
translated: do not be attached to them.

original: yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams mthong yang khong khro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams mthong yang khong khro bar mi bya'o //
translated: When you see unpleasant forms, do not be averse to them.

original: de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba rnams la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba rnams la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bar mi bya'o //
translated: In the same way, do not be attached to or averse to pleasant or unpleasant sounds, smells, tastes, or textures.

original: de dag bdag la sems pa yang ngo mtshar chen; bsod snyoms sbyin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag bdag la sems pa yang ngo mtshar chen; bsod snyoms sbyin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya ste /
translated: It is a great wonder that they think of me, let alone give me alms.

original: des de ltar yongs su yi chad pa med par bsod snyoms spyad par bya'o //🔽sems can gang dag de'i mig lam du snang bar 'gyur ba skyes pa dang bud med dang khye'u dang bu mo dang tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba de dag la yang byams pa dang / snying rje'i sems bskyed par bya'o; ;ci nas kyang sems can gang dag bdag gi mig lam du snang bar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: des de ltar yongs su yi chad pa med par bsod snyoms spyad par bya'o // sems can gang dag de'i mig lam du snang bar 'gyur ba skyes pa dang bud med dang khye'u dang bu mo dang tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba de dag la yang byams pa dang / snying rje'i sems bskyed par bya'o; ;ci nas kyang sems can gang dag bdag gi mig lam du snang bar gyur pa'am /
translated: In this way, he should go for alms without discouragement.🔽He should generate a loving and compassionate attitude toward all sentient beings who appear to his eyes, men and women, boys and girls, and even those born as animals.

original: bsod snyoms sbyin pa de dag mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ba de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms sbyin pa de dag mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ba de ltar bya'o //
translated: He should act in such a way that all sentient beings who appear to his eyes, or who give him alms, will go to heaven.

original: de ltar brtson @286b par bya'o //🔽des bsod snyoms ngan nam /
analyzed: de ltar brtson @286b par bya'o // des bsod snyoms ngan nam /
translated: He should strive in this way.

original: bzang yang rung blangs te /
analyzed: bzang yang rung blangs te /
translated: Whether the alms are good or bad,🔽he should accept them.

original: grong ngam / grong khyer ram /
analyzed: grong ngam / grong khyer ram /
translated: Whether it is a village or a city,

original: grong rdal 'di na bdag gi bsod snyoms 'di las bgo bsha' bya dgos pa'i sems can dbul po su yod snyam du phyogs bzhir kun du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: grong rdal 'di na bdag gi bsod snyoms 'di las bgo bsha' bya dgos pa'i sems can dbul po su yod snyam du phyogs bzhir kun du blta bar bya'o //
translated: He should look around in all directions, thinking, ‘In this town, who is a poor being to whom I should give a portion of this alms?’

original: gal te sems can dbul po zhig mthong na des bsod snyoms de las bgo bsha' bya'o //
analyzed: gal te sems can dbul po zhig mthong na des bsod snyoms de las bgo bsha' bya'o //
translated: If he sees a poor being, he should give him a portion of the alms.

original: gal te sems can dbul po ma mthong na; des 'di ltar gang dag bdag gi mig lam du snang bar ma gyur te /
analyzed: gal te sems can dbul po ma mthong na; des 'di ltar gang dag bdag gi mig lam du snang bar ma gyur te /
translated: If he does not see a poor being, he should think, ‘Those beings who are not visible to me,

original: mi snang ba'i sems can de dag la bsod snyoms kyi thog ma'i cha skal sbyin gyi /
analyzed: mi snang ba'i sems can de dag la bsod snyoms kyi thog ma'i cha skal sbyin gyi /
translated: who are not present, to them I give the first portion of the alms.🔽Having given it, may they enjoy it!’

original: byin nas len pa dag yongs su spyod cig snyam du sems bskyed la des bsod snyoms de khyer la /
analyzed: byin nas len pa dag yongs su spyod cig snyam du sems bskyed la des bsod snyoms de khyer la /
translated: He should take the alms and go to the wilderness.

original: dgon pa'i gnas der song la lhung bzed dang lag pa bkrus te /
analyzed: dgon pa'i gnas der song la lhung bzed dang lag pa bkrus te /
translated: Having washed his bowl and his hands,

original: dge sbyong gi spyod pa dang cho ga dang ldan pa'i spyod pa bzang pos byin gyis brlabs la de skyil mo krung bcas te bsod snyoms de bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi spyod pa dang cho ga dang ldan pa'i spyod pa bzang pos byin gyis brlabs la de skyil mo krung bcas te bsod snyoms de bza' bar bya'o //
translated: He should bless it with the good conduct of a monk, with the good conduct of a ritual.

original: ma chags pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / mi brkam pa dang / ma zhen pas zas zos nas 'di snyam du lus 'di la srin bu'i rigs brgyad khri yod pa de dag 'di'i mthus bde bar gnas par gyur cig /
analyzed: ma chags pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / mi brkam pa dang / ma zhen pas zas zos nas 'di snyam du lus 'di la srin bu'i rigs brgyad khri yod pa de dag 'di'i mthus bde bar gnas par gyur cig /
translated: Having eaten the alms, he should think, “May the eighty-four thousand types of worms that are in this body live happily through the power of this food.

original: da lta ni 'di dag zang zing gis bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: da lta ni 'di dag zang zing gis bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Now I will gather them with material things.🔽When I have attained Awakening, I will gather them with the Dharma.”

original: byang chub thob nas ni chos kyis bsdu bar bya'o snyam du sems bskyed do; ;gal te yang de'i bsod snyoms ngan par gyur na de 'di snyam du sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub thob nas ni chos kyis bsdu bar bya'o snyam du sems bskyed do; ;gal te yang de'i bsod snyoms ngan par gyur na de 'di snyam du sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: If his alms are poor, he should think,

original: kha zas ngan pas ni bdag gi lus yang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: kha zas ngan pas ni bdag gi lus yang bar 'gyur /
translated: “Through poor food, my body will be light.

original: spong pa bzang bar 'gyur /🔽bdag gi @287a *//
analyzed: spong pa bzang bar 'gyur / bdag gi @287a *//
translated: My meditation will be good.

original: bshad gci 'byung ba nyung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bshad gci 'byung ba nyung bar 'gyur /
translated: My urine and excrement will be small.

original: bdag la dad pas byin pa chung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag la dad pas byin pa chung bar 'gyur /
translated: I will have little faith in giving.

original: bdag gi lus yang ba dang sems yang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag gi lus yang ba dang sems yang bar 'gyur /
translated: My body will be light and my mind will be light.

original: bdag rmugs pa dang gnyid chung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag rmugs pa dang gnyid chung bar 'gyur /
translated: I will have little sluggishness and sleep.

original: bdag 'dod chags kyi sems kyis kun dkris par mi 'gyur ro snyam du yid la bya ba 'di lta bu 'di dag bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag 'dod chags kyi sems kyis kun dkris par mi 'gyur ro snyam du yid la bya ba 'di lta bu 'di dag bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I will not be bound by thoughts of desire.’

original: gal te des bsod snyoms mang zhig rnyed na de yang ran pa bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te des bsod snyoms mang zhig rnyed na de yang ran pa bza' bar bya'o //
translated: “If he obtains much alms-food, he should eat it in moderation.

original: dor ba'i chos nyid du yang bya ste /
analyzed: dor ba'i chos nyid du yang bya ste /
translated: He should also give it away.

original: bsod snyoms de las rdo leb gang yang rung ba'i steng du gtor la /
analyzed: bsod snyoms de las rdo leb gang yang rung ba'i steng du gtor la /
translated: He should scatter that alms-food on a flat stone and

original: 'di snyam du gcan zan dang / bya'i tshogs gang la la zang zing gi zas 'dod pa byin nas len pa de dag /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gcan zan dang / bya'i tshogs gang la la zang zing gi zas 'dod pa byin nas len pa de dag /
translated: think, ‘May those who wish for material food—lions, tigers, birds, and the like—take this and

original: 'di la zo zhig /🔽snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la zo zhig / snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: eat it!’

original: des zas zos nas lhung bzed dang lag pa bkrus te; dgon pa la brten nas gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: des zas zos nas lhung bzed dang lag pa bkrus te; dgon pa la brten nas gnas par bya'o //
translated: “Having eaten, he should wash his bowl and his hands, and then he should go to a solitary place.

original: sngon yid la byed pa'i chos de nyid kyang mi 'dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngon yid la byed pa'i chos de nyid kyang mi 'dor bar bya'o //
translated: And he should not abandon the Dharma that he has contemplated.

original: 'od srung / gal te dge slong dgon pa pa 'bras bu ma thob pa so so'i skye bo'i drung du sbrul dang / gcan zan gtum po dag 'ongs na des de la 'jigs pa dang / skrag par mi bya'i /
analyzed: 'od srung / gal te dge slong dgon pa pa 'bras bu ma thob pa so so'i skye bo'i drung du sbrul dang / gcan zan gtum po dag 'ongs na des de la 'jigs pa dang / skrag par mi bya'i /
translated: “Kāśyapa, if a monk in the wilderness who has not attained the fruits and is an ordinary person is approached by a snake or a fierce beast, he should not be afraid or terrified.

original: des 'di snyam du bdag thog ma nyid nas lus dang srog bor te dgon pa'i gnas su 'ongs kyi /🔽'di la bdag gis 'jigs par mi bya /
analyzed: des 'di snyam du bdag thog ma nyid nas lus dang srog bor te dgon pa'i gnas su 'ongs kyi / 'di la bdag gis 'jigs par mi bya /
translated: He should think, ‘From the very beginning I have come to this wilderness, giving up my body and life.🔽I should not be afraid of this.

original: skrag par mi bya'i /
analyzed: skrag par mi bya'i /
translated: I should not be terrified.

original: byams pa'i sems bskyed par bya /
analyzed: byams pa'i sems bskyed par bya /
translated: I should arouse thoughts of loving kindness.

original: zhe sdang rnam par spang bar bya /
analyzed: zhe sdang rnam par spang bar bya /
translated: I should abandon hatred.

original: 'jigs pa spang bar @287b bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa spang bar @287b bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I should abandon fear.’

original: gal te de ltar byas nas sbrul dang / gcan zan de dag gis srog gcod cing zan yang des 'di snyam du gcan zan 'di dag la bdag gis zang zing tsam gyis tshim par byed mi nus kyi /
analyzed: gal te de ltar byas nas sbrul dang / gcan zan de dag gis srog gcod cing zan yang des 'di snyam du gcan zan 'di dag la bdag gis zang zing tsam gyis tshim par byed mi nus kyi /
translated: If, having done so, those snakes and beasts kill him and eat him, he should think, ‘I am unable to satisfy these beasts with material things.

original: de dag gis bdag gi sha zos nas bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag gis bdag gi sha zos nas bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur la /
translated: They will eat my flesh and live happily.

original: bdag gis kyang snying po med pa'i lus la snying po blangs par 'gyur ba ni bdag gis rnyed pa legs par rnyed do //
analyzed: bdag gis kyang snying po med pa'i lus la snying po blangs par 'gyur ba ni bdag gis rnyed pa legs par rnyed do //
translated: And I will have obtained a good bargain, in that I will have taken the essence from this body which is without essence.

original: da ni 'di dag zang zing gis bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: da ni 'di dag zang zing gis bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Now I will attract them with material things.

original: byang chub thob nas ni chos kyis bsdu bar bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub thob nas ni chos kyis bsdu bar bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: And when I have attained enlightenment, I will attract them with the Dharma.

original: 'od srung / dgon pa la gnas pa'i dge slong gis de ltar lus dang srog la mi lta bar dgon pa la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / dgon pa la gnas pa'i dge slong gis de ltar lus dang srog la mi lta bar dgon pa la gnas par bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, a monk who lives in the wilderness should live in the wilderness without concern for body and life.

original: gal te dgon pa'i gnas pa de na gnas pa na mi ma yin pa 'ongs na mdog sdug kyang rung mi sdug kyang rung de la chags par mi bya /🔽khong khro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dgon pa'i gnas pa de na gnas pa na mi ma yin pa 'ongs na mdog sdug kyang rung mi sdug kyang rung de la chags par mi bya / khong khro bar mi bya'o //
translated: If nonhuman beings come to him, whether beautiful or ugly, he should not be attracted or repelled.

original: gal te sngon sangs rgyas mthong ba'i lha dag dge slong dgon pa pa'i gan du 'ongs te dri ba yongs su 'dri na /
analyzed: gal te sngon sangs rgyas mthong ba'i lha dag dge slong dgon pa pa'i gan du 'ongs te dri ba yongs su 'dri na /
translated: If a god who has seen the former Buddhas comes to the wilderness monk and asks him a question,

original: de la dge slong dgon pa pa des ji ltar thos pa bzhin du lha de dag la chos bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong dgon pa pa des ji ltar thos pa bzhin du lha de dag la chos bshad par bya'o //
translated: The monk who lives in the wilderness should teach the Dharma to those gods in accordance with what he has heard.

original: ji ste lha de dag zab mo'i dri ba yongs su 'dri ste /
analyzed: ji ste lha de dag zab mo'i dri ba yongs su 'dri ste /
translated: “If those gods ask him profound questions,

original: dge slong dgon pa pa des lan mi thebs pa lta na des nga rgyal med par byas la /
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa pa des lan mi thebs pa lta na des nga rgyal med par byas la /
translated: and if the monk who lives in the wilderness is unable to answer, he should not be proud.

original: 'di skad ces ma bslabs pa la brnyas par mi bya ste /🔽sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la lung mnos nas 'bad de khong du ma chud pa'i chos rnams khong du chud par gyur pa de'i tshe de'i dus na dris @288a *//
analyzed: 'di skad ces ma bslabs pa la brnyas par mi bya ste / sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la lung mnos nas 'bad de khong du ma chud pa'i chos rnams khong du chud par gyur pa de'i tshe de'i dus na dris @288a *//
translated: He should say, ‘One should not despise those who have not been trained.

original: pa thams cad kyi lan gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: pa thams cad kyi lan gdab par bya'o //
translated: When I have received the transmission of the Buddha’s teachings, and have understood the Dharma that I have not yet understood, then at that time, at that moment, I will answer all your questions.

original: bdag ni chos nyan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag ni chos nyan pa yin gyi /
translated: I am listening to the Dharma.

original: khyed spobs par gyis shig ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: khyed spobs par gyis shig ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: You should be eloquent.’

original: 'od srung / dge slong dgon pa pas de ltar lha de dag la go bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / dge slong dgon pa pas de ltar lha de dag la go bar bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, that is how the monk who lives in the wilderness should make those gods understand.

original: 'od srung / gzhan yang dge slong dgon pa pa dgon pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: 'od srung / gzhan yang dge slong dgon pa pa dgon pa la gnas pas /
translated: “Moreover, Kāśyapa, the monk who lives in the wilderness, who lives in the remote wilderness,

original: dgon pa'i 'du shes shin tu bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: dgon pa'i 'du shes shin tu bsgom par bya ste /
translated: He should cultivate the idea of the monastery as follows:

original: des lus 'di ni rtsva dang / shing dang / rtsig pa dang / bong ba dang / mig yor lta bu ste /🔽bdag po med pa /
analyzed: des lus 'di ni rtsva dang / shing dang / rtsig pa dang / bong ba dang / mig yor lta bu ste / bdag po med pa /
translated: “This body is like grass, sticks, walls, clods of earth, and illusions.🔽It is without a self,

original: bdag gi med pa /🔽yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi med pa / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'o //
translated: without a being,🔽without a soul, and without a person.

original: lus 'di la ni bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gang zag med kyi /
analyzed: lus 'di la ni bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gang zag med kyi /
translated: In this body there is no self, no being, no soul, and no person.

original: chos 'di dag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
translated: These phenomena are dependently arisen.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung zhing byed rgyu tshogs pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung zhing byed rgyu tshogs pa las byung ba ste /
translated: They arise from causes and conditions, and they arise from the coming together of many factors.

original: ci nas kyang bdag gi lta bar gyur pa thams cad nye bar 'gyur ba de ltar bdag gis tshul bzhin so sor brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: ci nas kyang bdag gi lta bar gyur pa thams cad nye bar 'gyur ba de ltar bdag gis tshul bzhin so sor brtag par bya'o //
translated: I should properly investigate in such a way that all my views will be eliminated.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos kyang rgyun mi 'chad par yid la bya'o snyam du de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos kyang rgyun mi 'chad par yid la bya'o snyam du de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: I should practice so that the phenomena of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness will be uninterrupted in my mind.”

original: dgon pa'i gnas de na gnas pa des rtsva dang / shing gel pa dang / sman dang / nags tshal de dag ji ltar 'byung ba dang / ji ltar 'jig par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po 'di dag bdag po med pa /
analyzed: dgon pa'i gnas de na gnas pa des rtsva dang / shing gel pa dang / sman dang / nags tshal de dag ji ltar 'byung ba dang / ji ltar 'jig par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po 'di dag bdag po med pa /
translated: devoid of a creature,

original: bdag gi med pa /
analyzed: bdag gi med pa /
translated: devoid of a person,🔽devoid of a human,🔽devoid of a descendant of Manu,🔽devoid of a master,🔽devoid of an owner,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa de ltar g-yo ba med cing byed pa med de /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa de ltar g-yo ba med cing byed pa med de /
translated: and devoid of appropriation.

original: @288b stong bzhin du skye zhing 'jig la /
analyzed: @288b stong bzhin du skye zhing 'jig la /
translated: He should observe how they arise and are destroyed while being empty.

original: su yang de dag skye bar mi byed /🔽'gog par mi byed pa'i mtshan ma bzung la /
analyzed: su yang de dag skye bar mi byed / 'gog par mi byed pa'i mtshan ma bzung la /
translated: No one causes them to arise or cease.

original: de bzhin du lus 'di yang rtsva dang / rtsig pa dang / shing dang / bong ba dang / mig yor lta bu ste /🔽bdag po med pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus 'di yang rtsva dang / rtsig pa dang / shing dang / bong ba dang / mig yor lta bu ste / bdag po med pa /
translated: He should observe the characteristics of those things and think, ‘In the same way, this body is like grass, a wall, a piece of wood, a pot, an illusion, and a dream.🔽It is devoid of a self,

original: bdag gi med pa /🔽yongs su 'dzin pa med pa /🔽g-yo ba med pa /
analyzed: bdag gi med pa / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa / g-yo ba med pa /
translated: devoid of a sentient being,🔽devoid of a life-force,🔽devoid of a creature,🔽devoid of a person,🔽devoid of a human,🔽devoid of a descendant of Manu,🔽devoid of a master,🔽devoid of an owner,

original: byed pa med pa /
analyzed: byed pa med pa /
translated: and devoid of appropriation.

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las 'byung gi /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las 'byung gi /
translated: It arises and is destroyed while being empty.

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang na mi 'byung ba ste; 'di la don dam par skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos gang yang med do snyam du mtshan ma gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang na mi 'byung ba ste; 'di la don dam par skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos gang yang med do snyam du mtshan ma gzung bar bya'o //
translated: If causes and conditions are incomplete, it does not arise. In this regard, one should apprehend the sign that ultimately there is no dharma whatsoever that arises or ceases.

original: 'od srung / de ltar dge slong dgon pa pas chos kyi yi dam kyi spyod pa 'di lta bus dgon pa la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / de ltar dge slong dgon pa pas chos kyi yi dam kyi spyod pa 'di lta bus dgon pa la gnas par bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, a monk dwelling in the wilderness should dwell in the wilderness with this kind of practice of the vow of the Dharma.

original: de lta bu'i chos la gnas pa de nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /🔽rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos la gnas pa de nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'am /
translated: One who dwells in the Dharma in this way will quickly become distinguished, whether one is a follower of the Vehicle of the Hearers,🔽a follower of the Vehicle of the Solitary Buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa zhig tu myur du khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa zhig tu myur du khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: or a follower of the Vehicle of the Bodhisattvas.

original: gal te nyan thos kyi theg pa par gyur na ni de myur du 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //🔽ji ste de las kyi sgrib pas bsgribs te 'bras bu thob par ma gyur na yang de zag pa rnams la sems rnam par grol gyi bar du de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis sam /
analyzed: gal te nyan thos kyi theg pa par gyur na ni de myur du 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro // ji ste de las kyi sgrib pas bsgribs te 'bras bu thob par ma gyur na yang de zag pa rnams la sems rnam par grol gyi bar du de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis sam /
translated: If one is a follower of the Vehicle of the Hearers, one will quickly attain the fruit.

original: gsum las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: gsum las mi 'da'o //
translated: But if one is obstructed by the obscurations of karma and does not attain the fruit, then one will not pass beyond two or three Tathāgatas until one’s mind is completely liberated from the defilements.

original: gal te rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa par gyur na ni de myur ba nyid du rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa par gyur na ni de myur ba nyid du rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were to become followers of the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, they would quickly attain the awakening of the solitary buddhas.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa par gyur na ni /
translated: If they were to become followers of the vehicle of the bodhisattvas,

original: de tshe 'di nyid la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de tshe 'di nyid la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: in this very life they would attain the acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: de sgrib pa med par sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur @289a *//
analyzed: de sgrib pa med par sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur @289a *//
translated: They would see the buddhas without any obscurations.

original: ro; ;sgrib pa med par sangs rgyas mthong nas myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro; ;sgrib pa med par sangs rgyas mthong nas myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having seen the buddhas without any obscurations, they would quickly awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: dgon pa pa'i le'u 'di bshad pa na /
analyzed: dgon pa pa'i le'u 'di bshad pa na /
translated: When this chapter on the wilderness was taught,

original: dge slong lnga brgya len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: dge slong lnga brgya len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: the minds of five hundred monks were liberated from defilements with no further grasping.🔽This was the fifth chapter, on the wilderness, of the great tantra of the Secret Essence of the Condensed Meaning of the Tantra.

original: dgon pa pa'i le'u ste lnga pa'o ////🔽'od srung / de la ji ltar na dge slong bsod snyoms spyod pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: dgon pa pa'i le'u ste lnga pa'o ////🔽'od srung / de la ji ltar na dge slong bsod snyoms spyod pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavajra🔽Kāyavaj

original: 'od srung / 'di la dge slong bsod snyoms spyod pas 'di ltar bdag bsod snyoms kyi kha zas la gnas te legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung la /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di la dge slong bsod snyoms spyod pas 'di ltar bdag bsod snyoms kyi kha zas la gnas te legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung la /
translated: Kāśyapa, a monk who goes for alms should think, ‘I will live on alms-food and go forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: bdag sngon gyi smon lam dang dam bcas pa la gnas par bya'o snyam du bslab par bya'o //🔽dge slong bsod snyoms spyod pa lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa des mi brkam pa dang / tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / kha gsag med pa dang / mgron du 'bod pa thams cad kyi sems med pa dang / dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa dang ma 'bags pa dang /🔽yid dam la brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag sngon gyi smon lam dang dam bcas pa la gnas par bya'o snyam du bslab par bya'o // dge slong bsod snyoms spyod pa lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa des mi brkam pa dang / tshul 'chos pa med pa dang / kha gsag med pa dang / mgron du 'bod pa thams cad kyi sems med pa dang / dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa dang ma 'bags pa dang / yid dam la brtan par bya'o //
translated: I will abide by my former aspirations and vows.’

original: des kha zas bzang po rnams la ro bro ba'i 'du shes thams cad kyi thams cad du bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: des kha zas bzang po rnams la ro bro ba'i 'du shes thams cad kyi thams cad du bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: That monk who goes for alms, who is intent, who is not greedy, who is not a hypocrite, who is not a braggart, who does not accept invitations, who does not mix with the saṅgha, and who is steadfast in his vows should not, under any circumstances, have any notion of the taste of good food.

original: des 'di ltar bdag gis gdol pa lta bu dang / lus dang sems gtsang mar bya'i /
analyzed: des 'di ltar bdag gis gdol pa lta bu dang / lus dang sems gtsang mar bya'i /
translated: He should be like a dog, and his body and mind should be pure.

original: kha zas kyis lus gtsang mar ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: kha zas kyis lus gtsang mar ni mi bya'o //
translated: Food does not make the body clean.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zas bzang po ji snyed cig zos kyang de thams cad ni @289b tha mar rnag tu zag go /
analyzed: zas bzang po ji snyed cig zos kyang de thams cad ni @289b tha mar rnag tu zag go /
translated: No matter how good the food is that you eat, in the end it all comes out as excrement.

original: tha mar mi mthun no //
analyzed: tha mar mi mthun no //
translated: In the end it is repulsive.

original: tha mar dri nga ba'o //
analyzed: tha mar dri nga ba'o //
translated: In the end it has a bad smell.

original: de lta bas na bdag gis bzang po 'dod par mi bya'o snyam du bslab par bya'o //🔽de der shin tu nges par sems pa'i sems kyis grong ngam /🔽grong khyer ram /
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag gis bzang po 'dod par mi bya'o snyam du bslab par bya'o // de der shin tu nges par sems pa'i sems kyis grong ngam / grong khyer ram /
translated: Therefore, I should not desire good food.🔽When he enters a village, town, or city for alms, he should do so with a mind that is very focused.

original: grong rdal du bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'jug pa na mthar chags su bslang bar bya'o //
analyzed: grong rdal du bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'jug pa na mthar chags su bslang bar bya'o //
translated: He should do so in an orderly manner.

original: des 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: des 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: He should arouse the following thought:

original: bdag la skyes pa bsod snyoms ster gyi /🔽bud med ni ma yin no zhe'am /🔽bdag la bud med bsod snyoms ster gyi skyes pa ni ma yin no zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag la skyes pa bsod snyoms ster gyi / bud med ni ma yin no zhe'am / bdag la bud med bsod snyoms ster gyi skyes pa ni ma yin no zhe'am /
translated: “If a man gives me alms, I will accept them.🔽If a woman gives me alms, I will accept them.🔽If a boy gives me alms, I will accept them.

original: bdag la khye'u bsod snyoms ster gyi bu mo ni ma yin no zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag la khye'u bsod snyoms ster gyi bu mo ni ma yin no zhe'am /
translated: If a girl gives me alms, I will accept them.

original: bdag la bu mo bsod snyoms ster gyi khye'u ni ma yin no zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag la bu mo bsod snyoms ster gyi khye'u ni ma yin no zhe'am /
translated: “I have a daughter, not a son, who will give me alms.”

original: bdag gis bzang po rnyed kyi ngan pa ni ma yin no zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gis bzang po rnyed kyi ngan pa ni ma yin no zhe'am /
translated: “I have found a good thing, not a bad thing.”

original: bdag gis bsti stang du byas nas rnyed kyi bsti stang du ma byas par ni ma yin no zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gis bsti stang du byas nas rnyed kyi bsti stang du ma byas par ni ma yin no zhe'am /
translated: “I have found it with respect, not without respect.”

original: bdag gis bde blag tu rnyed kyi sha thang par ma yin no zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag gis bde blag tu rnyed kyi sha thang par ma yin no zhe'am /
translated: “I have found it easily, not with difficulty.”

original: bdag la skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo bsu bar 'gyur ro zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag la skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo bsu bar 'gyur ro zhe'am /
translated: “I will be welcomed by men, women, boys, and girls.”

original: phyin ma thag tu sems par 'gyur ram /🔽bdag bstod dgos par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: phyin ma thag tu sems par 'gyur ram / bdag bstod dgos par 'gyur ram /
translated: “As soon as I arrive, I will be thought of.”🔽“I will be praised.”

original: shin tu bsdogs  pa rnyed par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: shin tu bsdogs  pa rnyed par 'gyur ram /
translated: “I will get what I want.”

original: bdag gis kha zas bzang po ro sna tshogs dang ldan pa rnyed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bdag gis kha zas bzang po ro sna tshogs dang ldan pa rnyed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: “I will get good food with a variety of tastes,🔽not bad food like the food of the poor.”

original: dbul po'i zas lta bu ngan pa ni rnyed pa ma yin no snyam du des mi dge ba'i yid la byed pa thams cad bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dbul po'i zas lta bu ngan pa ni rnyed pa ma yin no snyam du des mi dge ba'i yid la byed pa thams cad bskyed par mi bya'o //

original: 'di lta bu'i go cha ba go par yang bya ste /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i go cha ba go par yang bya ste /

original: @290a *// rnyed pa ma rnyed kyang yongs su yi chad par mi bya ba dang / ngan pa dang bzang po'i 'du shes bskyed par mi bya ba 'di ni dge slong bsod snyoms spyod pa dag gi chos nyid do //
analyzed: @290a *// rnyed pa ma rnyed kyang yongs su yi chad par mi bya ba dang / ngan pa dang bzang po'i 'du shes bskyed par mi bya ba 'di ni dge slong bsod snyoms spyod pa dag gi chos nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of monks who practice alms-begging not to be discouraged even if they do not obtain alms, and not to generate the notion of good or bad.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sems can phal cher ni rol brkam ste /
analyzed: sems can phal cher ni rol brkam ste /

original: zas kyi phyir sdig pa'i las rnams byas nas sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye'o //
analyzed: zas kyi phyir sdig pa'i las rnams byas nas sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye'o //
translated: Having committed sinful actions for the sake of food, they are reborn in the hells.

original: gang dag chog shes pa dang / mi brkam pa /
analyzed: gang dag chog shes pa dang / mi brkam pa /
translated: Those who are content, not greedy,

original: ma zhen pa /
analyzed: ma zhen pa /
translated: not attached,

original: ro la mi gdung ba /
analyzed: ro la mi gdung ba /
translated: not tormented by tastes,

original: lce'i dbang po chog shes pa /
analyzed: lce'i dbang po chog shes pa /
translated: with a contented faculty of taste,

analyzed: zas ngan don ci tsam gyis kyang 'tsho ba de dag shi 'phos te shi ba'i dus byas nas mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur /
translated: who live on just a little food, when they die and pass away, are reborn in the higher realms.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du bde 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du bde 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur /
translated: They go to the happy realms among gods and humans.

original: lhar skyes nas bdud rtsi za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhar skyes nas bdud rtsi za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having been reborn as a god, they eat nectar.

original: 'od srung / de ltar na bsod snyoms spyod pa'i dge slong gis rol srid pa bzlog ste; sems nges par sems pas lhag zan zhag bdun lon pa za yang yi chad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / de ltar na bsod snyoms spyod pa'i dge slong gis rol srid pa bzlog ste; sems nges par sems pas lhag zan zhag bdun lon pa za yang yi chad par mi bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, a monk who practices alms begging should think like this: “I will eat the leftovers of the seventh person, and I will not be discouraged.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lus gso ba dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi tshogs gsag pa'i don du bdag gis zas bza'o snyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus gso ba dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi tshogs gsag pa'i don du bdag gis zas bza'o snyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because I eat food for the sake of nourishing the body and gathering the provisions for the noble path.”

original: 'od srung / bsod snyoms spyod pa'i dge slong gis lhung bzed du 'ongs pa /
analyzed: 'od srung / bsod snyoms spyod pa'i dge slong gis lhung bzed du 'ongs pa /
translated: Kāśyapa, a monk who practices alms begging should eat food that comes into his bowl,

original: lhung bzed du chud pa /
analyzed: lhung bzed du chud pa /
translated: that fits into his bowl,

original: chos dang ldan pa /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa /
translated: that is in accordance with the Dharma,

analyzed: chos kyis rnyed pa tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i dge slong dag dang thun mong du byas la bza' bar bya'o //

original: 'od srung / gal te dge slong bsod snyoms spyod par gyur te /
analyzed: 'od srung / gal te dge slong bsod snyoms spyod par gyur te /
translated: Kāśyapa, if a monk who practices alms begging

analyzed: nad g-yog @290b med la bsod snyoms la 'jug kyang mi nus na /
translated: is unable to go on alms round because he has no one to attend to his illness,

original: des 'di snyam du bdag ni grogs med pa /
analyzed: des 'di snyam du bdag ni grogs med pa /
translated: he should think, “I am alone, without a companion.

original: bdag ni gcig pu gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: bdag ni gcig pu gnyis su med pa /
translated: I am alone, without a second.

original: bdag ni rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ni rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: I have gone forth.

original: bdag gi grogs ni chos yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi grogs ni chos yin te /
translated: My friend is the Dharma.

original: bdag ni chos la brten pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag ni chos la brten pa yin la /
translated: I rely on the Dharma.

original: bdag ni mi bde zhing sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: bdag ni mi bde zhing sdug bsngal te /
translated: I am unhappy and suffering.

original: rab tu na bas de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi sman gsungs pa gang yin pa de ji ltar thos pa bzhin du chos de dag bdag gis tshul bzhin brtag par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu na bas de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi sman gsungs pa gang yin pa de ji ltar thos pa bzhin du chos de dag bdag gis tshul bzhin brtag par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I am very sick. I will properly investigate those Dharmas, just as I have heard them, the Dharma medicine taught by the Tathāgata.”

original: 'od srung / de la gang lus 'di la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa 'di ni tshul bzhin la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / de la gang lus 'di la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa 'di ni tshul bzhin la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, properly applying oneself to this is to discern this body as it is, just as it is.

analyzed: de lus 'di la skyon du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa na tshul bzhin la zhugs pa de sems rtse gcig tu 'gyur zhing /
translated: When one properly discerns the faults of this body, one who has entered into the proper way will become one-pointed in mind.

original: dran pa dang ldan la shes bzhin dang ldan pas bsam gtan dang po bskyed pa'i gnas gang yin pa de yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan la shes bzhin dang ldan pas bsam gtan dang po bskyed pa'i gnas gang yin pa de yod par 'gyur te /
translated: “Endowed with mindfulness and introspection, they will give rise to the first meditative concentration.

original: des bsam gtan thob nas bsam gtan gyi bde ba 'dod pa na nyi ma gcig gam /
analyzed: des bsam gtan thob nas bsam gtan gyi bde ba 'dod pa na nyi ma gcig gam /
