original: nyi ma gnyis sam /
analyzed: nyi ma gnyis sam /
translated: two days,

original: nyi ma gsum nas nyi ma bdun gyi bar du bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i zas kyis gnas so //🔽gal te 'di ltar rnal 'byor la zhugs pa bsam gtan bskyed par mi nus na de ltar brtson zhing rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dge slong chos la gnas pa de la /
analyzed: nyi ma gsum nas nyi ma bdun gyi bar du bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i zas kyis gnas so // gal te 'di ltar rnal 'byor la zhugs pa bsam gtan bskyed par mi nus na de ltar brtson zhing rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dge slong chos la gnas pa de la /
translated: three days, up to seven days, subsisting on the food of the bliss of meditative concentration.

original: mngon par shes pa mngon par shes pa'i lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dag kha zas 'bul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa mngon par shes pa'i lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dag kha zas 'bul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “If, in this way, the one who has entered into practice is unable to give rise to meditative concentration, then, as that monk who is dedicated to the practice of yoga and who abides by the Dharma, the gods, nāgas, and yakṣas who possess supernormal knowledge will offer him food.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe @291a *//
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe @291a *//
translated: Why is that?

original: na; 'di ni rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa ste /
analyzed: na; 'di ni rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa ste /
translated: “This is the natural outcome for those who practice yoga,

original: des lhas yongs su bzung ba rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des lhas yongs su bzung ba rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they will obtain the support of the gods.🔽“

original: 'od srung / gal te sprin 'dus shing char bab ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / gal te sprin 'dus shing char bab ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, if clouds gather and rain falls,

original: bsod snyoms spyod pa'i dge slong bsod snyoms la 'jug mi nus pa'i dus kyi tshe byams pa'i zas kyi go bgos te /
analyzed: bsod snyoms spyod pa'i dge slong bsod snyoms la 'jug mi nus pa'i dus kyi tshe byams pa'i zas kyi go bgos te /
translated: and the time comes when a monk who goes for alms is unable to enter the village for alms, he should put on the armor of loving kindness.

original: chos sems pa yid la byed pa la gnas nas zhag gnyis sam /
analyzed: chos sems pa yid la byed pa la gnas nas zhag gnyis sam /
translated: He should abide in the thought of Dharma and mental focus, and if he misses a meal,

original: zhag gsum zhig zan chad na /
analyzed: zhag gsum zhig zan chad na /
translated: or two meals, or even three meals,

original: 'di ltar yi dvags gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa nyes par byed pa'i las byas pa gang dag lo brgyar yang mchil ma'i thal ba 'ga' tsam yang bzar mi rnyed pa dag kyang yod de /🔽de lta bas na bdag tshul bzhin du chos sems pa la gnas pas lus nyam chung ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar yi dvags gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa nyes par byed pa'i las byas pa gang dag lo brgyar yang mchil ma'i thal ba 'ga' tsam yang bzar mi rnyed pa dag kyang yod de / de lta bas na bdag tshul bzhin du chos sems pa la gnas pas lus nyam chung ba'am /
translated: he should think, “There are hungry ghosts in the world of the Lord of Death who, because of their bad actions, do not even get a drop of mucus to eat for a hundred years.

original: sems nyam chung ba bskyed par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sems nyam chung ba bskyed par mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, I will not let my body or mind become weak as I abide in the proper thought of Dharma.

original: bkres pa dang skom pas ji mi snyam par bya'o //
analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pas ji mi snyam par bya'o //
translated: I will not be concerned with hunger and thirst.

original: 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa la brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad par bya'o snyam du 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa la brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad par bya'o snyam du 'du shes bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I will strive to cultivate the noble path without interruption.”

original: 'od srung / dge slong bsod snyoms spyod pas khyim 'dris pa dang / skyes pa 'dris pa dang / bud med 'dris pa dang / khye'u 'dris pa dang / bu mo 'dris par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / dge slong bsod snyoms spyod pas khyim 'dris pa dang / skyes pa 'dris pa dang / bud med 'dris pa dang / khye'u 'dris pa dang / bu mo 'dris par mi bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, a monk who goes for alms should not be familiar with households, should not be familiar with men, should not be familiar with women, should not be familiar with boys, and should not be familiar with girls.

original: khyim gang na bsod snyoms gtsang ma byed pa'i khyim der stan la 'dug ste /
analyzed: khyim gang na bsod snyoms gtsang ma byed pa'i khyim der stan la 'dug ste /
translated: In a household where they make pure alms, he should sit on a seat there.

original: bsod snyoms gtsang ma byed pa zin gyi bar du chos kyi gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms gtsang ma byed pa zin gyi bar du chos kyi gtam brjod par bya'o //

original: de nas bsod snyoms de blangs la stan las langs te 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsod snyoms de blangs la stan las langs te 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having taken those alms, he should rise from his seat and leave.

original: 'od srung / bsod @291b snyoms spyod pa'i dge slong gis 'khod par mi bya'o //🔽kha gsag mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / bsod @291b snyoms spyod pa'i dge slong gis 'khod par mi bya'o // kha gsag mi bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, a monk who goes for alms should not be deceitful.🔽He should not flatter.

original: tshul bcos par mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshul bcos par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be hypocritical.

original: de la 'khod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'khod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is being deceitful there?

original: gang gzhan dag la tshig 'di skad ces smra ba ste /🔽bdag gi bsod snyoms ni ngan pa'o //
analyzed: gang gzhan dag la tshig 'di skad ces smra ba ste / bdag gi bsod snyoms ni ngan pa'o //
translated: It is when one says to others:🔽“My alms are bad.

analyzed: bdag gi bsod snyoms ni rtsub pa'o //
translated: My alms are coarse.”

original: bdag gis sngon 'di lta bu dang / ma 'grangs par ma zos so //
analyzed: bdag gis sngon 'di lta bu dang / ma 'grangs par ma zos so //
translated: I have never before eaten without being satisfied.

original: bdag gi bsod snyoms ni skye bo mang po dang thun mong du byas so; ;bdag gis nyung zhig zos te /
analyzed: bdag gi bsod snyoms ni skye bo mang po dang thun mong du byas so; ;bdag gis nyung zhig zos te /
translated: My alms-food was shared with many people. I ate little.

original: bdag ma 'grangs pas lus nyam chung ngo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag ma 'grangs pas lus nyam chung ngo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: I am not satisfied and my body is weak.

original: 'di ltar 'khod pa'i mtshan ma gang ci yang rung ba 'di lta bu 'di ni sems kyi tshul 'chos pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khod pa'i mtshan ma gang ci yang rung ba 'di lta bu 'di ni sems kyi tshul 'chos pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Any such signs of sitting in this way are called hypocrisy of the mind.

original: dge slong bsod snyoms spyod pas de dag thams cad mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong bsod snyoms spyod pas de dag thams cad mi bya'o //
translated: A monk who goes for alms should not do any of these things.

original: gang lhung bzed du 'ongs pa ngan kyang rung bzang yang rung /
analyzed: gang lhung bzed du 'ongs pa ngan kyang rung bzang yang rung /
translated: Whatever comes into the begging bowl, whether it is bad or good,

original: nyung yang rung mang yang rung /
analyzed: nyung yang rung mang yang rung /
translated: whether it is little or much,

original: gtsang yang rung mi gtsang yang rung ste /
analyzed: gtsang yang rung mi gtsang yang rung ste /
translated: whether it is clean or dirty,

original: de bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bza' bar bya'o //
translated: that should be eaten.

original: yongs su gdung ba med pa dang / bsam pa yongs su dag pa dang / chos nges par sems pa mang ba dang / lus gso ba dang / 'phags pa'i lam nye bar bstan pa'i phyir des bsod snyoms bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba med pa dang / bsam pa yongs su dag pa dang / chos nges par sems pa mang ba dang / lus gso ba dang / 'phags pa'i lam nye bar bstan pa'i phyir des bsod snyoms bza' bar bya'o //
translated: He should eat alms-food in order to be without distress, to purify his intentions, to have much Dharma discernment, to maintain his body, and to demonstrate the noble path.

original: 'od srung / gal te bsod snyoms spyod pas grong ngam /
analyzed: 'od srung / gal te bsod snyoms spyod pas grong ngam /
translated: “Kāśyapa, if a practitioner of alms-food does not receive alms-food in a village,

original: grong khyer ram /
analyzed: grong khyer ram /
translated: town, or city,

original: grong rdal du bsod snyoms bslangs te ma rnyed na; ji ltar lhung bzed bkrus pa bzhin du phyir byung na /
analyzed: grong rdal du bsod snyoms bslangs te ma rnyed na; ji ltar lhung bzed bkrus pa bzhin du phyir byung na /
translated: he should return as he came, his alms-bowl as it was when washed.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa yid la bya ste /
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa yid la bya ste /
translated: He should think of the Tathāgata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bsod nams kyi gzi brjid kyis brjid pa /🔽'khor los @292a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bsod nams kyi gzi brjid kyis brjid pa / 'khor los @292a *//
translated: the Tathāgata who is resplendent with the splendor of merit,🔽who abandoned a universal monarch’s kingdom

original: bsgyur ba'i rgyal srid spangs nas rab tu byung ba /
analyzed: bsgyur ba'i rgyal srid spangs nas rab tu byung ba /
translated: and went forth,

original: lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang dri zas mchod pa /
analyzed: lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang dri zas mchod pa /
translated: who is worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, and gandharvas,

original: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spangs pa /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spangs pa /
translated: who has abandoned all non-virtuous qualities,

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad dang ldan pa /
translated: who is endowed with all virtuous qualities,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: who is free from all afflictive emotions,🔽and who is the supreme field of merit.

original: de nyid grong du bsod snyoms kyi phyir gshegs na yang ji ltar lhung bzed bkrus pa bzhin du slar gshegs na /
analyzed: de nyid grong du bsod snyoms kyi phyir gshegs na yang ji ltar lhung bzed bkrus pa bzhin du slar gshegs na /
translated: When he goes to the village for alms, he returns with his begging bowl just as it was when it was washed.

original: bdag lta bu bsod nams chung ba /
analyzed: bdag lta bu bsod nams chung ba /
translated: “I, who have so little merit,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa ji ltar lhung bzed bkrus pa bzhin du phyir byung bas ci'i phyir yi chad par bya /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa ji ltar lhung bzed bkrus pa bzhin du phyir byung bas ci'i phyir yi chad par bya /
translated: who have not planted the roots of virtue, should not be discouraged if I return with my begging bowl just as it was when it was washed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pas kha zas bzang po dag mi rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pas kha zas bzang po dag mi rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because I have not planted the roots of virtue, I do not get good food.

original: gal te bdud kyi las sam /
analyzed: gal te bdud kyi las sam /
translated: If, because of the work of Māra,

original: bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis bram ze dang khyim bdag de dag bdag la bsod snyoms mi ster na /
analyzed: bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis bram ze dang khyim bdag de dag bdag la bsod snyoms mi ster na /
translated: or because of the influence of Māra, those brahmins and householders do not give me alms,

original: ci nas bdud bzhi las yang dag par 'das pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ba de ltar bya'o snyam du bsam mo //
analyzed: ci nas bdud bzhi las yang dag par 'das pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ba de ltar bya'o snyam du bsam mo //
translated: I will act in such a way that I will transcend the four Māras and be free from all afflictions.”

original: de ltar nga'i nan tan la gnas pa de la bdud dang bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar nga'i nan tan la gnas pa de la bdud dang bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, Māra and the gods of the class of Māra will not find an opportunity in me.

original: 'od srung / dge slong bsod snyoms spyod pas de ltar 'phags pa'i rigs rnams yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / dge slong bsod snyoms spyod pas de ltar 'phags pa'i rigs rnams yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, a monk who practices alms begging should purify the family of the noble ones in this way.

original: bsod snyoms spyod pa'i le'u ste drug pa'o ////
analyzed: bsod snyoms spyod pa'i le'u ste drug pa'o ////
translated: This concludes the chapter on alms begging, the sixth in the “Ratnakūṭa” section called “The Discourse of Vimalagarbha.”

original: 'od srung / de la dge sbyong phyag dar khrod pa pas ji lta bu'i sems kyis phyag dar khrod pa bsdu bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srung / de la dge sbyong phyag dar khrod pa pas ji lta bu'i sems kyis phyag dar khrod pa bsdu bar bya zhe na /
translated: Kāśyapa, what kind of mind should a monk who wears discarded rags have when he collects discarded rags?

original: @292b ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pas g-yogs pa'i sems su bya'i /
analyzed: @292b ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pas g-yogs pa'i sems su bya'i /
translated: He should have a mind covered with a sense of shame and decency,

original: chos gos kyis cha bar sbyor ba la brtson pa'i sems kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos gos kyis cha bar sbyor ba la brtson pa'i sems kyis ni ma yin no //

original: gnyis gang zhe na /

analyzed: des phyag dar khrod pa de blangs nas legs par bkrus te /

analyzed: 'od srung / de ltar na dge slong phyag dar khrod pa pas khyod dang / nga'i rjes su bslab par bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, a monk who wears discarded rags should train in accordance with me and you.

original: 'od srung / 'di lta bu'i dus dang / 'di lta bu'i man yod de /🔽'od srung / chos gos ngan pa gyon pa /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta bu'i dus dang / 'di lta bu'i man yod de / 'od srung / chos gos ngan pa gyon pa /
translated: Kāśyapa, there are times and occasions🔽when, Kāśyapa, you wear poor robes,🔽and you are content with poor robes.

original: chos gos ngan don gyis chog par 'dzin pa khyod gang du chos gos snam sbyar khri'u 'am /🔽khri'i steng du bzhag ste /
analyzed: chos gos ngan don gyis chog par 'dzin pa khyod gang du chos gos snam sbyar khri'u 'am / khri'i steng du bzhag ste /
translated: You place your patchwork robe on a bed or a bench🔽and,🔽having put on your upper robe, you go out for a walk.🔽At that time, many hundreds of thousands of gods come there

original: khyod bla gos gyon nas 'chag sar 'chag pa'i tshe lha brgya stong phrag mang po dag der lhags nas /
analyzed: khyod bla gos gyon nas 'chag sar 'chag pa'i tshe lha brgya stong phrag mang po dag der lhags nas /
translated: and

original: 'di ni tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i lus la bgo bgo ba'i chos gos so zhes khyod kyi chos gos snam sbyar de la phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i lus la bgo bgo ba'i chos gos so zhes khyod kyi chos gos snam sbyar de la phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the Dharma robe that is worn on the body that is dyed with morality, concentration, and wisdom.”

original: 'od srung ltos /
analyzed: 'od srung ltos /
translated: “Kāśyapa, look!

original: chos gos la yang phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur na lus la lta mi smos /
analyzed: chos gos la yang phyag 'tshal bar 'gyur na lus la lta mi smos /
translated: If you pay homage to the Dharma robe, then what need is there to mention the body?”

original: 'od srung / ji ltar na dge slong nga'i rjes su slob pa dag de bzhin du bsgrub par 'gyur snyam ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / ji ltar na dge slong nga'i rjes su slob pa dag de bzhin du bsgrub par 'gyur snyam ste /
translated: “Kāśyapa, how do the bhikṣus who are my disciples practice in accordance with the Dharma?

original: ngas 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal srid spangs nas rab tu byung ste ka shi ba phra mo dang / du ku la'i ras dang / ko tam pa'i ras dang / ngang ris can gyi chos gos rnams spangs nas /
analyzed: ngas 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal srid spangs nas rab tu byung ste ka shi ba phra mo dang / du ku la'i ras dang / ko tam pa'i ras dang / ngang ris can gyi chos gos rnams spangs nas /
translated: I renounced a universal monarch’s kingdom and went forth, and I abandoned the finest garments of Kāśi cotton, dukūla, koṭambaka, and waterfowl feathers,

original: 'phags pa'i rigs la dga' @295b ba'i phyir sha na'i ras kyi gos rnams lus la bgos so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs la dga' @295b ba'i phyir sha na'i ras kyi gos rnams lus la bgos so //
translated: and I wore the garments of coarse śāṇi cloth because I delighted in the family of the noble ones.”

original: 'od srung / ngas khyod las dar gos ngan pa blangs te ngas khyod la sha na'i ras byin pa gang yin pa de thams cad kyang khyod nyid la snying brtse ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: 'od srung / ngas khyod las dar gos ngan pa blangs te ngas khyod la sha na'i ras byin pa gang yin pa de thams cad kyang khyod nyid la snying brtse ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: Kāśyapa, I took from you a poor cotton cloth and gave you a linen cloth, all out of love for you.

original: chags pa'i phyir ma yin la /
analyzed: chags pa'i phyir ma yin la /
translated: It was not out of desire,

original: lus brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: lus brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: nor was it to adorn my body.

original: 'od srung / 'di la mi gti mug pa kha cig khyod dang nga'i rjes su mi slob cing brkam pa chags pa'i zil gyis gnon pa /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di la mi gti mug pa kha cig khyod dang nga'i rjes su mi slob cing brkam pa chags pa'i zil gyis gnon pa /
translated: Kāśyapa, in this regard, some deluded people, not training in accordance with me or you, overcome by greed and desire,

original: chos gos gsog par byed pa dang / lhung bzed gsog par byed pa /
analyzed: chos gos gsog par byed pa dang / lhung bzed gsog par byed pa /
translated: accumulate Dharma robes, accumulate alms bowls,

original: 'jig rten gyi zang zing gsog par byed pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zang zing gsog par byed pa /
translated: accumulate worldly goods,🔽accumulate cowries, gold, jewels, and grain,

original: 'gron bu dang / gser dang / nor bu dang / 'bru gsog par byed pa /
analyzed: 'gron bu dang / gser dang / nor bu dang / 'bru gsog par byed pa /
translated: and

original: ba glang dang / lug dang / bya gag dang / phag dang / bong bu dang / rta dang / thong shol dang / shing rta 'dren pa dag nye bar 'jog par byed pa; khyim pa'i las kyi mtha' spyod pa dag pas ni /
analyzed: ba glang dang / lug dang / bya gag dang / phag dang / bong bu dang / rta dang / thong shol dang / shing rta 'dren pa dag nye bar 'jog par byed pa; khyim pa'i las kyi mtha' spyod pa dag pas ni /
translated: They keep cattle, sheep, chickens, pigs, donkeys, horses, carriages, and draft animals.

original: 'od srung / khyim pa dag la khyad par du 'gyur ba yod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'od srung / khyim pa dag la khyad par du 'gyur ba yod mod kyi /
translated: Kāśyapa, householders may have distinctions,

original: mi blun po rab tu byung ba'i mtshams las 'das pa de dag la ni khyad par 'gyur ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: mi blun po rab tu byung ba'i mtshams las 'das pa de dag la ni khyad par 'gyur ba gang yang med do //
translated: but for those fools who transgress the boundaries of going forth, there are no distinctions at all.

original: 'od srung / khyim pa rnams khyad par du 'gyur ba ni dge sbyong ma yin la dge sbyong du khas 'che ba /
analyzed: 'od srung / khyim pa rnams khyad par du 'gyur ba ni dge sbyong ma yin la dge sbyong du khas 'che ba /
translated: Kāśyapa, householders may have distinctions, but they are not spiritual practitioners, yet they claim to be spiritual practitioners.

original: tshangs par spyod pa ma yin la tshangs par spyod par khas 'che ba /🔽gos ngur smrig bgos shing bya ba mang ba /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ma yin la tshangs par spyod par khas 'che ba / gos ngur smrig bgos shing bya ba mang ba /
translated: They are not celibate, yet they claim to be celibate.🔽They wear saffron robes, yet they are very busy.

original: sbags pa sna tshogs kyis spags pa zas dang gos lhur len pa de dag khyim pa dag gis gos ngur smrig @296a *//
analyzed: sbags pa sna tshogs kyis spags pa zas dang gos lhur len pa de dag khyim pa dag gis gos ngur smrig @296a *//
translated: They are defiled by various impurities, and they are preoccupied with food and clothing.🔽Householders may give them saffron robes,

original: gyon par rig nas zhes dang gus pa bskyed pa dang / chos gos dang bsod snyoms kyis sdud par byed pa dang / gus par smra zhing phyag 'tshal la /
analyzed: gyon par rig nas zhes dang gus pa bskyed pa dang / chos gos dang bsod snyoms kyis sdud par byed pa dang / gus par smra zhing phyag 'tshal la /
translated: Knowing that they are wearing the Dharma robes, they will generate respect, and they will gather them with Dharma robes and alms.

original: ldang bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: ldang bar byed pa ste /
translated: They will speak respectfully, pay homage, and rise up for them.

original: 'od srung / 'di ni khyim pa de dag gi khyad par du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di ni khyim pa de dag gi khyad par du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Kāśyapa, this is the difference between those householders

original: de dag rab tu byung ba de dag la ni med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rab tu byung ba de dag la ni med pa'o //
translated: and those who have gone forth.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag ni yongs su len pa la brtson pa ma yin zhing ci yang mi gsog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni yongs su len pa la brtson pa ma yin zhing ci yang mi gsog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those who have gone forth are not diligent in accumulating things and do not accumulate anything at all.

original: 'od srung / de'i tshe de'i dus na dge slong phal cher lhung bzed dang / chos gos mang zhing snod spyad mang ba dang / rnyed pa mang bar 'gyur te /🔽de dag la bsti stang byed par 'gyur /🔽btsun par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'od srung / de'i tshe de'i dus na dge slong phal cher lhung bzed dang / chos gos mang zhing snod spyad mang ba dang / rnyed pa mang bar 'gyur te / de dag la bsti stang byed par 'gyur / btsun par byed par 'gyur /
translated: Kāśyapa, at that time and in those days, most monks will have many alms bowls and Dharma robes, many utensils, and many possessions.🔽They will be honored,🔽respected,

original: ri mo byed cing mchod pa byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri mo byed cing mchod pa byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: and revered.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de sbyin pa dang / phyir sbyin pa dus dus su byed cing bya ba ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de sbyin pa dang / phyir sbyin pa dus dus su byed cing bya ba ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, they give and give again, and they are always ready to help others.

original: dge slong gang dag tshul khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can zag pa rnams zad par byed pa la mngon par brtson pa dang / yid byung ba mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba bzhin du brtson pa /
analyzed: dge slong gang dag tshul khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can zag pa rnams zad par byed pa la mngon par brtson pa dang / yid byung ba mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba bzhin du brtson pa /
translated: “There will be monks who are ethical, who have virtuous qualities, who are dedicated to exhausting the defilements, who are diligent like their hair and clothes are on fire,

original: don nyung ba /
analyzed: don nyung ba /
translated: who have few desires,

original: byed pa nyung ba /
analyzed: byed pa nyung ba /
translated: who have few activities,

original: rang gi don la brtson pa 'dris par byed pa yongs su spangs pa dag 'byung ba de dag gi gan du ni /
analyzed: rang gi don la brtson pa 'dris par byed pa yongs su spangs pa dag 'byung ba de dag gi gan du ni /
translated: who are dedicated to their own goals, and who have given up socializing.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na su yang mi 'gro /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na su yang mi 'gro /
translated: At that time, no one will go to them,

original: mi bsten cing bsnyen bkur mi byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi bsten cing bsnyen bkur mi byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: no one will rely on them, and no one will serve them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na @296b 'di ltar khyim pa dag ni chags pa'i rang bzhin can tshe 'di lhur len gyi /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na @296b 'di ltar khyim pa dag ni chags pa'i rang bzhin can tshe 'di lhur len gyi /
translated: Why is that? It is because householders are by nature attached and focused on this life.

original: tshe rabs phyi ma lhur len pa ma yin pas de dag 'di snyam du dge slong de dag la ni bdag cag gi 'tsho ba med na; bdag cag gis ci'i phyir bsten /🔽ci'i phyir phyag bya /🔽ci'i phyir mchod /
analyzed: tshe rabs phyi ma lhur len pa ma yin pas de dag 'di snyam du dge slong de dag la ni bdag cag gi 'tsho ba med na; bdag cag gis ci'i phyir bsten / ci'i phyir phyag bya / ci'i phyir mchod /
translated: They do not strive for future lives, so they think, ‘If we do not have a livelihood because of those monks, why should we serve them?🔽Why should we bow down to them?🔽Why should we make offerings to them?

original: ci'i phyir bsnyen bkur bya snyam du sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsnyen bkur bya snyam du sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why should we honor them?’

original: gzhan du na gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa sngon gyi sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dag 'byung zhing /
analyzed: gzhan du na gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa sngon gyi sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dag 'byung zhing /
translated: “But there are some who have planted roots of merit, who have made excellent preparations in the past,

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can de lta bu de dag la bsten par byed /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dge ba'i chos can de lta bu de dag la bsten par byed /
translated: who are endowed with moral discipline, and who have virtuous qualities.

original: bsnyen par byed cing bsnyen bkur byed pa ni ma gtogs te nyung ngo //
analyzed: bsnyen par byed cing bsnyen bkur byed pa ni ma gtogs te nyung ngo //
translated: They are few, except for those who serve, honor, and venerate such people.

original: 'od srung / chos 'di lta bu tshul dang mthun pa 'di lta bu 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'od srung / chos 'di lta bu tshul dang mthun pa 'di lta bu 'di dag ni /
translated: “Kāśyapa, these kinds of Dharma are in accord with this,

original: gang zag gnyis kyi yid du 'ong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zag gnyis kyi yid du 'ong bar 'gyur te /
translated: and they are pleasing to two kinds of people.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: bden pa mthong zhing 'khor ba la 'jigs par lta ba dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa la brtson zhing 'bras bu thob par 'dod pa las kyi rnam par smin pa la rton pa /
analyzed: bden pa mthong zhing 'khor ba la 'jigs par lta ba dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa la brtson zhing 'bras bu thob par 'dod pa las kyi rnam par smin pa la rton pa /
translated: They see the truth and fear saṃsāra. They are diligent in the practice of yoga and desire to attain the result, and so they rely on the ripening of karma.

original: chos don du gnyer zhing chos 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: chos don du gnyer zhing chos 'dod pa'o //
translated: They pursue the Dharma and long for the Dharma.

original: 'od srung / mngon par mi brtson pa chos ma yin pa la lta ba /
analyzed: 'od srung / mngon par mi brtson pa chos ma yin pa la lta ba /
translated: Kāśyapa, I will explain the gateway of all those who do not strive, who have views that are not the Dharma,

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa dang 'gal ba /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa dang 'gal ba /
translated: who are in conflict with the ripening of karma,

original: 'jig rten pha rol du kha na ma tho bas 'jigs par mi lta ba; tshe 'di lhur len pa /🔽tshe rabs phyi ma lhur mi len pa thams cad kyi sgo ngas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol du kha na ma tho bas 'jigs par mi lta ba; tshe 'di lhur len pa / tshe rabs phyi ma lhur mi len pa thams cad kyi sgo ngas bshad par bya'o //
translated: who do not fear the misdeeds of the next world, who are intent on this life,🔽and who do not strive for future lives.

original: 'od srung / gang dag tha na thar pa dang ldan pa'i sems gcig tsam yang @297a *//
analyzed: 'od srung / gang dag tha na thar pa dang ldan pa'i sems gcig tsam yang @297a *//
translated: Kāśyapa, I will explain the gateway of those who have even a single thought connected with liberation.

original: mi bskyed pa'i mi gti mug pa de dag la ni ngas 'di lta bu'i chos 'di skabs mi 'byed kyi steng du 'di lta bu'i chos 'di dag thos na bdag sgrub pa las nyams par rig nas smad par bya bar sems te /
analyzed: mi bskyed pa'i mi gti mug pa de dag la ni ngas 'di lta bu'i chos 'di skabs mi 'byed kyi steng du 'di lta bu'i chos 'di dag thos na bdag sgrub pa las nyams par rig nas smad par bya bar sems te /
translated: Moreover, if they were to hear this kind of Dharma, they would think that it should be criticized, knowing that it would cause them to fall away from their practice.

original: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin gyi 'di dag ni rang bzor sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin gyi 'di dag ni rang bzor sbyar ba'am /
translated: They would say, ‘This was not taught by the Buddha, but rather was composed by oneself or

original: bdud kyis mtho btsams nas byas pa'o zhes smra zhing /
analyzed: bdud kyis mtho btsams nas byas pa'o zhes smra zhing /
translated: was created by Māra after he had gained access.’

original: de dag 'di lta skye bo mang po dag log par 'dzin du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag 'di lta skye bo mang po dag log par 'dzin du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, they would cause many people to hold wrong views.

original: de dag ni bdag nyid kyang phung la gzhan kyang phung bar byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid kyang phung la gzhan kyang phung bar byed par 'gyur /
translated: They would destroy themselves and cause others to be destroyed.

original: bdag kyang nyon mongs pa can du gyur la gzhan yang nyon mongs pa can du byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag kyang nyon mongs pa can du gyur la gzhan yang nyon mongs pa can du byed par 'gyur te /
translated: They would be afflicted themselves and cause others to be afflicted.

original: de ltar mi gti mug pa de dag ni bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mi gti mug pa de dag ni bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa ma yin no //
translated: In this way, those confused people would not be engaged in benefiting themselves or others.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Mahākāśyapa said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'dir nan tan snying por bgyid pa'i gang zag chos kyi dbang phyug rnams la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'dir nan tan snying por bgyid pa'i gang zag chos kyi dbang phyug rnams la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen
translated: “Blessed One,

original: po gang lags pa de rgya cher yang dag par rab tu bshad lags so //
analyzed: po gang lags pa de rgya cher yang dag par rab tu bshad lags so //
translated: the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha has extensively explained in this Dharma discourse called ‘The Heap of Jewels’ the great compassion of the blessed buddhas for those individuals who are lords of the Dharma and who make practice their essence.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: sems can gang dag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos nas @297b gos shing de bzhin nyid du sgrub pa de dag ni sangs rgyas kyis yongs su bzung ba lags so //
analyzed: sems can gang dag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos nas @297b gos shing de bzhin nyid du sgrub pa de dag ni sangs rgyas kyis yongs su bzung ba lags so //
translated: those beings who, having heard this Dharma discourse, wear it and practice in accordance with reality are upheld by the Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽'od srung / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / 'od srung / de de bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: “Kāśyapa, it is so, it is so.🔽It is just as you have said.

original: gang dag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos nas mos shing de bzhin nyid du sgrub pa'i sems can de dag ni sangs rgyas kyis yongs su bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang dag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos nas mos shing de bzhin nyid du sgrub pa'i sems can de dag ni sangs rgyas kyis yongs su bzung ba yin no //
translated: Those sentient beings who, having heard this Dharma discourse, will believe in it and practice in accordance with reality will be sustained by the Buddha.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda:🔽“Ānanda, you should uphold this chapter on the Dharma for the sake of those sons and daughters of good family

original: kun dga' bo khyod kyis rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
analyzed: kun dga' bo khyod kyis rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
translated: who have planted roots of virtue,

original: zhi ba 'dod pa /
analyzed: zhi ba 'dod pa /
translated: who desire peace,

original: grol bar 'dod pa de dag gi ched du chos kyi le'u 'di gzung zhig /
analyzed: grol bar 'dod pa de dag gi ched du chos kyi le'u 'di gzung zhig /
translated: and who desire liberation.

original: khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba de dag kyang chos 'di la bslabs nas phung po thams cad rab tu spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba de dag kyang chos 'di la bslabs nas phung po thams cad rab tu spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those householders and renunciants who train in this Dharma will attain nirvāṇa, which is the complete abandonment of all the aggregates.🔽” Ānanda said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bdag gis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bzung lags na /
analyzed: bdag gis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bzung lags na /
translated: I have upheld this Dharma discourse.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
translated: what is the name of this Dharma discourse?

original: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
translated: How should I remember it?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: de'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di chos thams cad yang dag par bsdus pa zhes bya bar yang gzung zhig /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di chos thams cad yang dag par bsdus pa zhes bya bar yang gzung zhig /
translated: therefore, you should also remember this Dharma discourse as ‘The Compendium of All Dharmas.’
